loans.name: Gnabana Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupement nommé « GNABANA », Mr Kodjovi âgé de 42ans est marié à une ménagère et ont ensemble de 08 enfants dont 05 scolarisés. Le premier a 17ans et le dernier 04ans. Ils sont constitués de femmes et d’hommes et sont tous dans le domaine de la terre. Le responsable est dans cette activité il y a 17ans. Vu la grandeur de sa superficie, il est aidé par 05 membres de sa famille et 08 employés et son activité se déroule en REGION CENTRALE. afin d'avoir un bon rendement, il sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour acheter des outils de travail.Il voudrait avec le profit, construire une maison en dur et augmenter sa superficie.
texts.en:
Responsible for the group named GNABANA, Kodjovi is 42 years old and married to a housewife. Together they have 8 children of whom 5 go to school. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest 4 years old. 

The group consists of men and women who are all working in the domain of farming. The representative has been in this business for 17 years. Given the size of his acreage, he is helped by 5 members of his family and 8 employees and his business takes place in the central region. In order to have a good yield, he is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy work tools. With the profits he would like to build a permanent house and expand his acreage.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old and widowed with six children. She has been in the shoe-selling business for one year and also works in small-scale farming. Her income per month is approximately KES 25,000 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan of KES 100,000 to purchase new shoes for resale.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay school fees and save the remaining amount to reinvest in her business. She hopes to open a big boutique and shoe shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Vy´a Renda Group

texts.es:
El comité Vy´a renda tiene 15 integrantes, realizan actividades distintas pero de igual forma se ayudan mutuamente como grupo que son ya que el objetivo es aprovechar al máximo la unión que tienen gracias al crédito y también seguir fomentando el trabajo en equipo.
La sra. Victoria se dedica a la costura, es mamá soltera tiene una hija de 11 años. Victoria tiene como meta tener su propio negocio de costura y asi  brindando un mejor estilo de vida a su familia como ser alimentacion, vivienda, educacion, osio, etc.  
Ella retiro el crédito para la inversion de materiales variadas para aumentar mas sus ingresos ( telas hilos, etc), poder confeccionar más ropas para la venta, tener mas ropas que ofrecer.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Vy’a Renda” consists of 15 members who engage in different business activities, but they share in the responsibility of helping one another as a group. Their goal is to make the most of their work as a group as they utilize this loan. They also want to continue promoting a spirit of teamwork.

Sra. Victoria is a seamstress and single mother of an 11-year-old daughter. Her goal is to have a sewing business so that she can provide a better lifestyle for her family in terms of food, shelter, education, activities, and other necessities.

Victoria will utilize her loan by investing in various materials to increase her earnings such as fabric, thread, and other supplies. This will enable her to produce more clothing that she can offer and sell.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline is 28 years old. She is married to a house builder. She sells fabrics. With the loan, she wants to buy more fabrics for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising livestock. Gina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: For more than three years, Eva has made a living operating a retail store that sells a variety of food and home-use products. She lives in Macabibo, Sapang Dalaga, and is a 34-year-old married mother of one child. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from her business. Recently, Eva joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussein's first loan helped him improve and expand his services. He now has a greater base of customers in different and further areas. 

To make it easier for his customers, he's decided to work on opening another branch of his shop in another area, so he applied for this loan to get more tools, more aluminum, and goods to start the expansion process.

loans.use: to get more tools, aluminum and goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Senan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENAN est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ahissi Céline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Ahissi Céline est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un transporteur du nom de Lucien. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Ahissi Céline a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Ahissi Céline exerce comme activité, la couture dans son atelier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Parallèlement à cette activité, Ahissi Céline vend des tissus basins. Ahissi Céline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Ahissi Céline désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Ahissi Céline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group SENAN consists of three people who are friends. The representative of this group, named Ahissi Céline, is the one whose hand is raised on the photo. This is the first time that this group is asking for financial support from ALIDé in order to elevate the level of their business. Ahissi Céline is 37 years old and is married to a trucker named Lucien. The couple has two children, of whom one goes to school and all are under their care. Ahissi Céline stopped school at the primary level.

For almost five years Ahissi Céline has been in business sewing in her workshop, which allows her to meet the needs of her family without great difficulty. Simultaneously, Ahissi Céline sells bazin fabric [colorful African fabric]. Ahissi Céline gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. In order to better respond to the demands of her clientèle, Ahissi Céline would like to strengthen and diversify her business. In order to do this, Ahissi Céline is requesting, together with the other members of the SENAN group, a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bazin fabric.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano cuenta con 12 integrantes mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias pero en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de todo tipo de productos como ropas, carbón, frutas y verduras, alimentos ya hechos, joyas, etc. La conformación del comité es reciente, se encuentra en el 1er ciclo de igual forma se encuentran muy entusiasmadas y con ganas de seguir emprendiendo para seguir generando ingresos que son de mucha ayuda para apaciguar los gastos de la familia.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Nelly se dedica a la venta de comidas como sandwiches, empanadas, chipas, croquetas, etc. 
El crédito utilizado sería para comprar ingredientes para preparar estas minutas, necesita lechuga, tomate, harina, pan, huevos, aceites de cocina, etc.
texts.en:
The committee San Cayentano has twelve members who are all women and are dedicated to various activities but the majority work selling clothes, coal, fruit, vegetables and ready-made food, jewelry etc. The committee formed recently and in their first cycle find themselves very enthusiastic and with the desire to continue undertaking their work to continue earning incomes that are a lot of help in meeting family costs. 
One of the members, Ms. Nelly, sells food like sandwiches, empanadas, chips, croquettes etc. 
This loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make these dishes and she needs to buy lettuce, tomatoes, four, bread, eggs, cooking oils etc.

loans.use: purchase oils, eggs, lettuce, butter, etc.

loans.name: Super Poderosa Group

texts.es:
El comite de Super Poderosa son todas vecinas de su comunidad, cuenta con 13 integrantes muy responsables y exigentes con respecto al pago de las cuotas.Todas son  muy responsables y trabajadoras se reunen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo, al mismo tiempo ayudan a su comunidad siempre que pueden para que asi puedan salir adelante todos juntos.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Karina es vendedora de cosméticos relacionados a los tratamientos faciales como cremas, exfoliantes, algodones, etc.
El crédito solicitado sería para re invertir en el negocio de la señora, comprando mayor cantidad de productos para luego venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, "Super Poderosa (Super Powerful)", are all neighbors in the community.  It is made up of 13 members who are very responsible and diligent with the payment of their dues.  All of them are are very responsible hard workers and always meet to resolve any issues the group has.  At the same time they help their community whenever possible so they can move forward together.

One of the members, Karina, sells cosmetics related to facial treatments such as creams, scrubs, cotton, etc.  The loan would be used to reinvest in her business, such as buying more products and then selling them at higher prices to her customers.

loans.use: to buy easy treatment products such as creams, scrubs, cotton, etc.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El sr. Oscar tiene 21 años es soltero, no tiene  hijos, es comerciante, también está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Derecho, es de la ciudad de Yaguarón, ubicado en el barrio centro, vive con sus padres el Sr. Oscar, quien cuenta con una antigüedad de 2 años, en la venta de mercaderías como polietilenos, muebles etc. trabaja por varias ciudades del país como Carapeguá, Quiindy, San Ignacio y Ayolas.
Obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela formada  de varias zonas del país.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de mercaderías, ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar  y obtener un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Oscar is 21 years old. He has no children and is a merchant. He is also in his third year of studying law. He is from Yaguarón, located in the central neighborhood. He lives with his parents. Oscar, who has 2 years experience selling merchandise such as plastic items, furniture, etc. he works in different cities in the country such as Carapeguá, Quiindy, San Ignacio and Ayolas.

He gets a very good monthly income and has regular customers in different area in the country.

He plans on using the loan to buy merchandise, since this way he can expand and obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Aquiles Santiago

texts.es:
AQUILES SANTIAGO TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO TIENE UN HIJO DE 21 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON EL HIJO EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

AQUILES SANTIAGO  SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA SEMANA. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ MEJORAR LOS PRODUCTOS.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS Y LA LANCHA EN LOS CULTIVOS. EL SUEÑO ES TENER ÉXITO EN LA VIDA Y MÁS INGRESOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PRACTICAR EL DEPORTE.
texts.en:
Aquiles Santiago is 43 years old, single, and has a 21-year-old son. He and his son live in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Aquiles is a member of the July 30th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Zapotal Nuevo in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farm laborers.

Aquiles Santiago is a farmer who grows rice, beans, and corn. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer. His purchases and the sale of his products are conducted in the city of Ventanas on a weekly basis. With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve the crops he produces. The challenges he faces include dealing with diseases and fungi that could damage his crops.

In his free time, Aquiles Santiago enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras cuenta con 12 integrantes mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias, desde la venta de carbón hasta ser niñeras de los hijos de algunas familias mas pudientes.Las integrantes del comité son muy responsables, emprendedoras y creativas ya que utilizan todos los recursos disponibles para poder ayudar a sus familias económicamente.
La señora Emelia se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y alcohólicas. Ella cuenta con una despensa en su casa que le hace mucho mas fácil el trabajo ya que también se dedica a la venta de carbón en su casa, con esta actividad ella genera ingresos para su familia.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) communal bank has 12 members who work in a series of activities going from the sale of coal to child minders for wealthier families. The members of the communal bank are very responsible, enterprising and creative as they use all the resources available to them in order to support their families financially.

Emelia makes her living selling alcoholic and fizzy drinks. She owns a counter in her home which makes working much easier as she also sells coal in her home, through this activity she generates an income for her family. The loan she is seeking is to buy a larger volume of merchandise to satisfy her customers’ needs

loans.use: to buy alcoholic and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 33 años de edas, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros tiene cuatro hijos,vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Los productos compra  y vende en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para compra de semillas, urea, insecticidas, abonos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas el cogollero. El sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta cocinar y hacer quesos.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and four children who are unmarried.  She lives in the Canton Ventanas river province.  

The communal bank "V.R.C. El DIVINO NIÑO", which is located by Estero Lindo (part of Canton Ventanas), supports its members of short cycle farming like corn and rice.  Maria is in the business of farming corn and rice in addition to raising livestock.  She purchases and sells her products in Ventanas.

She is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, and fertilizer.  This loan would help her economically to purchase the necessary supplies.  She faces challenges like armyworms.  Her dream is to one day purchase a farm.  

She likes to cook and make cheese.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: De Los Angeles Benita Florencia

texts.es:
BENITA tiene 63 años de estado civil en Union Libre con el compañero y con los hijos . Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

DE LOS ANGELES BENITA FLORENCIA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y comprar terreno para dejar a los hijos.

Le gusta ver la television y festejar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Benita, 63, is in a common law relationship; she lives with her spouse and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. The “Ciudadela los Ángeles” communal bank is located in Recinto Los Ángeles belonging to Ventanas Canton. This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming. 

De los Ángeles Benita Florencia is a corn and rice farmer. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market there and in street markets in surrounding areas. 

She requested the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer for her corn and rice crops. The loan has helped her increase income for her family’s consumption and to invest. Her dream is to be in good health to continue working and to buy a piece of land to leave to her children. 

She enjoys watching television and celebrating at community festivals.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Jesus Flora

texts.es:
Jesus Flora tiene 32 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Jesus Flora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, cerdos. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea líquido mata monte y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para comprar los productos sin ningún tipo de problenmas. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. El sueño es seguir trbajando. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con lo hijos.
texts.en:
Jesus Flora, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. The communal bank SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE is located in Sibimbe in Ventanas canton. The bank has 20 members who do seasonal farmwork such as planting corn and rice. Jesus Flora is a farmer who plants corn and also raises chickens and pigs. She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and sells at the fair there.

She is requesting this loan to buy seed, urea, pesticide, and fertilizer.  With the loan, she will be able to purchase the supplies without any problems. Jesus Flora faces challenges like insects that attack the plantings. She dreams of continuing to work and likes to spend her free time with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, pesticide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida de 60 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de ropa femenina desde el año 1990, cuando después de realizar estudios técnicos en modistería, inició su propio negocio, el cual ha crecido poco a poco entre su clientela femenina, que es la línea en la cual trabaja. Zoraida en su negocio realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, desde el diseño, corte preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y   sobre medidas, respondiendo uno a uno a su clientela, por quien trabaja durante 10 horas diarias, en las que se encuentra literalmente ceñida a su máquina. Las compras de sus insumos las hace de contado en almacenes especializados de costuras, siendo sus principales clientes las personas que habitan su sector y sus referidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como telas, hilos, encajes y accesorios para dar a sus diseños el mejor acabado posible y ajustado a los gustos de sus clientes y a la moda. Su meta mas adelante es adecuar nuevas maquinarias y construir una segunda planta, donde separar su espacio productivo del familiar y así lograr que todos en casa obtengan mayor sosiego.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 60 years old, and has made a living sewing women's clothing since 1990. She spent time studying dressmaking, and eventually started up her own business, which has grown little by little over the years as she has expanded her customer base. In her business, Zoraida sews all kinds of garments, and also designs and prepares different components for use in final articles of clothing. When selling her merchandise, she accepts cash, and also allows clients to make scheduled payments on credit for their orders. She works ten hours per day at her sewing machine responding to client orders, and also purchases materials with cash at various wholesale stores for use in sewing her products. The majority of her clients live nearby, or are referred to her by mutual friends.  

Zoraida is presently applying for her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and plans to use the support from the loan to purchase raw materials for making her products, including: fabric, thread, lace, accessories, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to improve the quality of the articles she designs and makes, and will allow her to cater to the styles and preferences of her clients. Her goals for the future are to acquire a greater variety of sewing machines that would allow her to broaden the scope of her work, as well as to build a new workshop that would allow her to separate her work from her house and bring greater peace and tranquility to her home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as thread, fabrics, lace and accessories for sewing her products.

loans.name: Amparo Evelyn

texts.es:
AMPARO EVELYN TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERA  NO TIENE HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS PADRES EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

AMPARO EVELYN  SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES, UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA 20 DÍAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ SER MAS PRODUCTIVO.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS. EL SUEÑO ES TENERUNA BUENA COSECHA. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASAR CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Amparo Evelyn is 20 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of the communal bank 30 de Julio, which is located in the area of Zapotal Nuevo, belonging to the canton of Ventanas, an agricultural area. 

Amparo Evelyn works in agricultural growing rice, beans and corn. She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizer, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer.

Buying and selling of products take place in the city of Ventanas every 20 days. The loan will help her to be more productive. 

She faces challenges such as pests. Her dream is to have a good harvest. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer, urea, compost and liquid weed killer

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
JOSE MERCEDES TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO TIENE UN HIJO DE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON EL HIJO EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

JOSE MERCEDES  SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA 20 DÍAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS, LANCHA EN LOS CULTIVOS. EL SUEÑO ES TENER ÉXITO EN LA VIDA Y MÁS INGRESOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PRACTICAR EL DEPORTE.
texts.en:
Jose Mercedes is fifty years old. He is single and has a twenty-year-old son. He lives with his son in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios province. He belongs to the rural solidarity group 30 de Julio, which is located in Zapotal Nuevo and belongs to the canton of Ventanas. Its members are farmers.

Jose Mercedes is a farmer. He grows rice, beans, and corn. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, urea and other fertilizers, and liquid weed killers.

He will make his purchases and sell his products in the city of Ventanas every twenty days. The loan will allow him to improve his crops. He faces challenges, such as pests and late blight on his crops. His dream is to succeed in life and have more income. He enjoys playing sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, urea and other fertilizers, and liquid weed killers.

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Yvette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Sourou. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Yvette vit ensemble avec ses trois enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Yvette mène comme activité la vente des boules de pâtes faites à base de l’amidon du maïs et des poissons à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Yvette vend de la boisson locale. Yvette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Yvette sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JESUGNON is a group of two people, whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Yvette (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 47 years old and is married to a chauffeur named Sourou. The couple has six children, some of whom are in school and three of whom are their dependents. Yvette never had the opportunity for herself to receive a formal education. Yvette lives with three of her children and her husband. Together, the couple provides for all of the various household expenses. 

For nearly ten years Yvette has been running her business selling fish and corn starch based pasta balls from her home. Yvette also sells local beverages to supplement her income. Yvette performs her work with passion, as it enables her to meet her own needs as well as those of her children. Yvette buys her supplies from a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy the demands of her customers, Yvette is requesting a fourth loan along with the other JESUGNON group members. This loan will help them to better satisfy the demands of their clientele and therefore to earn more income. Their previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn, fish and local beverages.

loans.name: Carlos Ismael

texts.es:
Carlos Ismael tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Carlos Ismael se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. 

Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos. Con la ayuda del credito podrá realizar la siembra esperada sin ningún tipo de problemas.
 
Enfrenta desfíos comó las plagas en los cultivos cómo el cogollero, la langosta y la lancha en los sembríos.
El sueño es poder comprar máquina agrícola. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en: Carlos Ismael is 43 years old and married with three children.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos province.  The “Strength and Work” Communal Bank is located in “Caimito II” precinct in the Puerto Pechiche parish belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is engaged in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and grandule beans.  Carlos Ismael is engaged in farming.  He plants corn, rice, and grandule beans and also raises animals.  He buys and sells his products in Ventanas Canton.  He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and farming inputs such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer to keep the crops in good condition.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to carry out the expected planting without any problems.  He faces many challenges with his crops such as blight caused by armyworms, locusts, and frost in the sown fields.   His dream is to buy farming equipment.  In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farming inputs such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Olimpia Odalia

texts.es:
OLIMPIA ES SOLTERA  TIENE UN HIJO VIVE CON LOS PADRES POR QUE SON ELLOS LOS QUE LE AYUDAN A CUIDAR AL NIÑO.

OLIMPIA ES PROFESORA EN UNA ESCUELA EL DINERO LO VA A UTILIZAR EN EDUCACION PARA SU HIJO, ELLA SUEÑA CON QUE EL HIJO SIGA ESTUDIANDO Y SEAN PROFESIONALES.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A PASAR CON LOS HIJOS
texts.en:
Olimpia is single, has one child, and lives with her parents who help her take care of the child. 

Olimpia is a teacher in a school. She is going to use the money for her children's education. She dreams of her children continuing their schooling and being professionals.

She spends her free time with her children.

loans.use: To pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
Jenny Marisol tiene 34 años de edad vive en unión libre con su esposo y con sus  hijos en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Jenny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno y construir la casa para la familia
En su  tiempo libre le gusta salir a bailar y pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Jenny Marisol is 34 years old and lives in a civil union marriage with her husband and her children who are 17, 16, 13, 11 and 4 years old. They live in the Pueblo Viejo canton of Ventanas which is part of Los Rios province.

The members of VRC Unido Somos live in the El Marañón neighborhood near the Puerto Pechiche parish of the Pueblo Viejo. This woman from Ventanas makes a living in agriculture with short cycle crops including corn, rice and beans. She buys her materials in the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells her goods in the Castillo market. She is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice, beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers for her crops. 

The support of the credit will help her economically to cover her needs. She faces challenges including plagues, diseases and the changes in the climate. With the help of the credit, it will be easier to acquire her farm supplies. Her dream is to be able to buy some land and construct a house for her family. 

Her dream is to buy her own land. In her free time she likes to go out dancing and walking with her children.

loans.use: to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Olmedo

texts.es:
JOSE TIENE 28 AÑOS ES CASADO VIVE EN CHIMBO TIENE TRES HIJOS. 

SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS EL DINERO LO VA A INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA SE FERILIZANTES SEMILLAS Y ABONOS EL DINERO DE LE AYUDADO DE GRAN MANERA QUE HA PODIDO AUMNETAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE JOSE ES AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION PARA TENER UNA EJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA. EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA SALIR A CAMINAR CON LA ESPOSA Y CON LOS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old, married, and lives in Chimbo. He has three children.

He is a farmer. He grows potatoes. He will invest the money in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds. The money has been of great help to him, and it has allowed him to increase production.

Jose's dream is to increase production so that he can have a better quality of life. He enjoys going out for walks with his wife and children in his spare time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Tania Dora

texts.es: La señora Tania  tiene 24 años oriunda de la ciudad de La Paz,  su actividad económica es venta frutas según a la temporada, se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, el destino del crédito es para la compra fruta de la temporada por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, la Sra. Tania a pesar de ser una persona joven  trabaja mucho, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos que le permite mantenerse y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Tania is 24 years old and a native of the city of La Paz. Her business is selling seasonal fruit, and she has be has been in this business for two years. The loan will be used to buy seasonal fruit wholesale to stock her sales point. Despite being young, Tania works a lot, since this is her only source of income that allows her to support herself and to help her parents with the household expenses. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: María Raquel

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a su hija y su mamá. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, actividad que aprendió de su mamá. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar la mercadería, su casa limpia y la ropa lavada. Luego levanta a su hija, le prepara el desayuno y la alista para que se vaya a la escuela. Posteriormente, Maria se dirige a recorrer su ruta de trabajo que es alrededor de diez a quince kilómetros. La mercadería la compra en la capital del país, viaja dos veces por semana, debido a que ahí consigue un mejor precio.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Su objetivo es, proporcionarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y reparar el techo de su vivienda, puesto que tiene unas goteras por donde se filtra el agua lluvia.
texts.en:
María is a 31-year-old single mother living together with her daughter and her mother.  She has made a living selling clothing for the last several years, a skill she learned from her mother. 

She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare the merchandise, get her house cleaned up and the clothes washed. Then she wakes up her daughter, makes her breakfast and gets her ready to go to school. Later, Maria turns her focus to walking her route for work, which is around 10 to 15 kilometers long. She purchases merchandise in the country's capitol, traveling two times a week due to the fact that she can get a better price there. 

The loan will be dedicated to the purchase of more clothing in order to stock up her business and improve her income. Her goal is to provide a better quality of life to her daughter and repair the roof of her home, since it has some holes through which it leaks rainwater.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to stock up her business and improve her income

loans.name: Nancy Cecilia

texts.es:
NANCY CECILIA TIENE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERA TIENE UN HIJO, VIVE CON EL HIJO EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINICIA DE LOS RIOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

NANCY CECILIA  SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES, RANGER, UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA 20 DÍAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS INSUMOS.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS, LANCHA EN LOS CULTIVOS. EL SUEÑO ES TENER ÉXITO EN LOS CULTIVOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA REALIZAR LOS QUEHACERES DOMESTICOS.
texts.en:
Nancy Cecilia is 34 years old. She is single and has one child. She lives with her son in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios province.

She belongs to the rural solidarity group 30 de Julio, which is located in Zapotal Nuevo and belongs to the canton of Ventanas. Its members are farmers.

Nancy Cecilia is a farmer. She grows rice, beans, and corn. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, fertilizers, herbicides, urea, and liquid weed killers.

She will make her purchases and sell her products in the city of Ventanas every twenty days. This loan will allow her to buy the supplies. She faces challenges, such as pests and late blight on her crops. He dream is to be a successful farmer. She enjoys doing housework in her spare time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, herbicides, urea, and liquid weed killers.

loans.name: Luisana Virginia

texts.es:
Luisana tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión Libre con el esposo y su hija en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. 

Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más y construir la casa. 
En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres domesticos y pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
27-year-old Luisana lives with her husband and daughter in Ventanas, Pueblo Viejo canton, los Ríos province.

The 'Unido Somos' community bank is located in El Marañón neighborhood, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Luisana grows corn, rice and beans.  She buys her supplies from the Karlita Agricultural Supplies Store and sells her produce in Castillo's Store.

Luisana is requesting this loan so that she can sow corn, rice and beans.  She will buy seeds, urea, farming supplies, manure and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the support of this loan, Luisana will be able to cover her financial needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, diseases and changes in the weather.  This loan will make it easier for her to obtain supplies.

Luisana's goal is to buy a plot of land so that she can grow a lot more.  In her free time, she enjoys doing her housework and spending time with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies and liquid fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas desde hace varios años de los cuales obtiene los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Los insumos para elaborar las pupusas las compra en las tiendas de su comunidad y en una ciudad que esta a 24 kilómetros de donde vive. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para mejorar su vivienda, ya que las paredes se encuentran en mal estado y tiene que repellarlas para que estén más seguras y resistan a las condiciones climáticas.  Con la inversión ella estará más segura y no tendrá miedo de habitar en su hogar.
texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old. She is a single mother of a son. She has been making and selling stuffed tortillas for several years in order to obtain earnings to support her family. She buys her ingredients to make the tortillas in the stores in her community and in a city that is 24 kilometers from where she lives.

She is asking for a loan through Fundación Campo, in order to improve her housing as the walls are in a state of disrepair and she needs to plaster them so they become more secure and so that they are able to resist the weather conditions. The money from the loan will help her be more secure and she will not be afraid to live in her home.

loans.use: to improve her housing as the walls are in a state of disrepair and she will become more secure and not be afraid to live in her home.

loans.name: Ofelia Carolina

texts.es:
Ofelia carolina vive en  la ciudad de Managua, se dedica a comercializar sus productos  a sus clientes  a domicilio,  la señora ofrece  ropa y zapatos para  damas y caballeros, pero también trabaja como fotógrafo  brinda sus servicios a eventos especiales como bodas, quince años, promociones escolares; realiza toma de fotografía y video.

 En su crédito anterior con CEPRODEL   Ofelia ha podido mejorar su negocio, ya que ha comprado  una laptop y una cámara profesional para la toma de su fotografía y mejorar sus servicios fotográficos. 

Este crédito Ofelia  lo solicita para aumentar su negocio, lo invertirá en compra de ropa y calzados,  así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Ella comercializa su mercadería al crédito y de contado.
doña Ofelia agradece a CEPRODEL  y KIVA  por que  gracias a ellos ha podido crecer en su negocio y por ende aumentar sus ganancias y así brindar mejores condiciones de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Ofelia Carolina lives in the city of Managua, and works selling her products to her customers door-to-door. She offers men and women's clothing and shoes, but also works as a photographer. She provides services at special events, such as weddings, fifteenth birthday celebrations, and school graduations. She takes pictures and films video.

Ofelia's last loan through Ceprodel allowed her to improve her business, since she bought a laptop and a professional camera to take pictures and improve her photography service. 

Ofelia is requesting this loan to increase business. She will invest it in the purchase of clothing and shoes in order to meet her customers' demand. When selling her merchandise she accepts credit and cash. 

Ofelia is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva because they have allowed her business to grow. Her earnings have also increased accordingly, and she can now provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase used shoes and clothing to increase inventory and offer her customers more variety.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 61 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family, and runs a general store in the Philippines.  She is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Cresenciana has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from selling fruits and raising livestock.

Cresenciana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Neaman

texts.en:
Neaman is from Iraq.  He is 39 years old, married and has four children.  He is the only provider for the family.

Neaman owns a bakery.  He established his business in 2009 and he has one employee.  He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1,700 loan to renovate his bakery.  He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Aurora De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Aurora de los ángeles vive en la ciudad de Managua, Nicaragua es  casada  con dos hijos.
Su negocio consiste en venta de ropa y calzados para damas y caballeros, comercializa al crédito y de contado u  otros productos por encargo esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.

Cuando empezó a ser préstamo con ceprodel la actividad del negocio era venta de nacatamales pero decidió cambiar la acción por que la agitación del fuego le estaba afectando la piel. Por esta razón decide trabajar con crédito para tener un mayor capital ya que la inversión es mayor.

Este crédito los solicita para Compra de ropa y calzado, invertirá en nueva mercadería. Doña aurora agradece la oportunidad que ceprodel  le brinda para la inversión de su negocio ya que con las ganancias  que obtiene le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Aurora de los Ángeles lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is married and has two children. She sells men and women's clothing and other custom-ordered products on credit and for cash. Her business is located in her home. 

When she started taking loans from Ceprodel, her business was selling pork tamales, but she decided to change courses because the cooking fire was affecting her skin. That is why she decided to work with a loan, so that she could have more capital and a larger investment.

She is requesting this loan to invest in new merchandise. She will purchase clothing and shoes. Aurora is grateful for the opportunity Ceprodel has offered her to invest in her business, because the earnings she obtains allow her to help her husband with family expenses.

loans.use: to invest in new merchandise by purchasing clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Zulaikah

texts.en:
Zulaikah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga, in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of which currently attends school. For the past three years Zulaikah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells hardware and building materials. 

To help expand her business, Zulaikah has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cement, nails, iron bars and iron sheets for resale. This will help Zulaikah generate greater profits and pay school fees. Zulaikah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Zulaikah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, iron bars and iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Ceina

texts.es: Ceína de 34 años de edad vive  con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 16 años. Hace 8 años Cenia se dedicaba a elaborar almuerzos que vendía, pero se enfermó y por prescripción médica debió dejar de hacerlo, por eso años después de recuperada su salud, se dedicó a una actividad, que le permitiera continuar generando ingresos y al mismo tiempo atender a sus hijos. Así fue como invirtió un pequeño capital en frutas tropicales y dulces, para venderlo desde su propia casa, poco a poco agregó chichas de maíz, pasabocas, refrescos tropicales congelados y galletas elaboradas por ella misma y su madre, los cuales prepara a base de panela. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y su mercado son sus vecinos. Ella antes había recibido un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual compró un congelador, para el almacenamiento de los productos congelados como hielo y bolis.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará pasabocas, chocolates, bolis y chicha, en mayor volumen,  para fortalecer su venta y aumentar su capital de trabajo.   Pues su meta es lograr aumentar sus utilidades y en el futuro adecuar el espacio donde está su negocio.
texts.en:
Ceína, 34, lives with her spouse and their three children, aged between 12 and 16 years old. Eight years ago, Ceína made a living preparing lunches that she sold, but she got sick and it was medically necessary for her to stop doing it. For that reason, years after regaining her health, she started a service that allowed her to continue generating income and at the same time attend to her children. 

This was how she ended up investing a small amount of capital in sweet tropical fruits, to be sold from her own home, little by little adding corn chicha beverages, snacks, tropical frozen sodas and cookies made by herself and her mother, which she prepares from a base of unrefined whole cane sugar.

She makes her sales in cash and her market is her neighbors. Previously, she had received a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she bought a freezer for the storage of frozen goods such as ice and ice cream products. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy snacks, chocolates, ice cream products and chicha in larger volumes in order to strengthen her sales and raise her working capital. Her goal, then, is to achieve an increase in her profits and in the future, adapt the space where she has her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, chocolates, ice cream treats and chicha

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 18 years old, single, and lives with his seven-member family of whom three are employed. 

Diaa owns a small shop for miscellaneous goods such as tools and supplies. He established his business in 2011, and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2400 youth loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and increase his inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 31 years old and married.  She has one child who is two years old. She has been in the business of selling green tea leaves for the last seven years, earning approximately KES 50,000 monthly.  Stella also owns a small restaurant for additional income. 

This is Stella's fourth loan with KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She borrowed KES 60,000 and plans to use it on purchasing green tea leaves for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Stella plans to save and reinvest in her business. She also hopes to purchase a piece of land for planting tea.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Janat has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells charcoal, sugarcane, tomatoes, and pumpkins. 

To help expand her business, Janat has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to resell and will help Janat generate greater profits and pay for food for her children. Janat hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Janat is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 32 years old. He is a father of three children aged between two and four. He has a videotheque business and he has been running this business for four years. With this loan, Emmanuel wants to add more machines and software to produce quality images for his clients. He plans to use the profits for renovating the place he lives.

loans.use: To buy more machines and software for quality images.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Alaa owns a clothes shop. He specializes in sportswear. He established his business in 2004, and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Alaa is requesting a loan of $1800 to redecorate his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en: Cesarie is 45 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been running this business for 16 years. She is requesting a loan so she can buy more foodstuffs, such as potatoes and bananas, for resale. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as potatoes and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Moncerrate Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad,  se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Monserrate tiene 37 años de edad, es viuda y de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 8 años, el mayor esta en la universidad, dos de ellos están en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante con sus hijos  se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y sandalias de damas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana de cuatro a cinco horas diarias,  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días,  en las noches se dedica a ayudarles a sus hijos en las tareas sobre todo al más pequeño. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil ciudad a la que va una vez al mes y en ciertas ocasiones hasta dos veces por mes, lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio actividad con la que saca sola adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa y zapatos porque allá salen más barato. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir  los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local donde vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
In the citadel El Progreso, in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank Illusiones meets twice a month. This is a very poor area of the city with urban marginality, that is known as the prison sector because the Portoviejo prison for women is located here.

Monserrate is 37 years old. She is a widow and from her marriage she had four children who are 18, 16, 12 and 8 years old. The oldest is at university and two of them are in school and one in primary.

She is a fighting woman who is eager to get ahead for her children, and she works selling all types of clothing, and shoes and sandals for women going from door-to-door. She works four days a week from four to five hours a day, leaving her goods on credit and collecting payment every eight days. At night she helps the children with their homework, above all the youngest. She buys her supplies in Guayaquil, going there once a month and sometimes twice a month and has been doing this activity for 15 years which is how she is bringing up the children on her own.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and shoes in Guayaquil because it is cheaper to buy there. She has been with the communal bank for three years and she likes it for the ease of getting loans.

Her dream is to have her own facility where she could sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell door-to-door as she is a widow bringing up four children on her own

loans.name: Gloria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora gloria cristina vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua. Tiene su  pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación, ella empezó su negocio con venta de refresco y enchilada pero gracias a los prestamos que CEPRODEL y KIVA le han financiado ha crecido en el negocio ahora vende gaseosa, refrescos, granos básicos, y productos perecederos,  la actividad del negocio  empieza a las siete de la mañana y cierra  a las 9 de la noche. 

Este crédito lo esta solicitando para Compra de  gaseosa, azúcar, jugos, y perecederos, con el fin de incrementar su inventario. Ya que la demanda de sus clientes ha aumentado, espera que le puedan apoyar para seguir con sus propósitos. 

Doña gloria  se siente agradecida por que el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio por que ahora oferta más productos a sus clientes y sus ventas son de contado. Y sus planes consisten en   seguir trabajando con CEPRODEL y teniendo mas variedad de productos  aumentara el margen de ganancia. Para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Cristina lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. She has a small business in her home. She started her business selling sodas and enchiladas, but thanks to loans from Ceprodel and Kiva, she has grown her business and now sells other soft drinks, basic grains, and perishable products. She begins working at 7:00 am and closes at 9:00 pm.

She has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, sugar, juices, and perishable products to increase her inventory. Her customers' demand has increased, and she hopes you can help her and support her in achieving success.

Mrs. Gloria feels thankful because the time she has been working with loans has allowed her to improve her business as she now offers more products to her customers and her sales have increased. Her plans are to continue working with Ceprodel and have more variety of products to increase her profit margin and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, sugar, juices, and perishables to offer a greater variety of high quality products.

loans.name: Purnachandra

texts.en:
Purnachandra is a 40-year-old physically challenged person living with his wife who is 30 years old. He runs a small business in his area. He collects the waste products like polythene, iron, discarded glass/plastic bottles and sells them to a local scrap dealer. He has five years of experience in this business. In this way, he earns 3,000 to 3,500 INR per month. He wants to start a grocery shop in his village, but because of financial problems, he can’t. 

He applied for a loan of 30,000 INR to set up a grocery shop along with his waste product business in his village. He will use this loan to purchase grocery items like rice, lentils, cooking oil, spices, biscuits, chocolate etc. He wants to start this business so that he can earn more.  He says that he can earn 5,000 INR from this business, but at present, he is not able to do the same because of lack of funds. He hopes to construct a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, cooking oil, spices, biscuits, chocolates etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramón de Jesús de  54 años de edad, con tres  hijos, este senor es de la zona de chichigalpa que queda en la zona de occidente del pais, dicho municipio de caracteriza por ser una zona de produccion de cana de azucar, mucho ganadao y siembra de platanos. Ramon  tiene por negocio la venta de leche y plátanos, el cual está ubicado en su pequena  finca y la distribuye de forma ambulante. El cuenta con una experiencia de 12 años,porque era agricultor, con la reforma agraria el gobierno le otorgo tierras a él a su familia, en base a su experiencia como agricultor y su espíritu de emprendedor  se dedico a trabajar con su familia  y hacerla producir para el sustento de su hogar, en la actualidad el Sr. Ramón tiene sueños y metas como es ampliar mas su finca para trabajar y producir más y tener mayores ingresos  en su hogar.
Ramón se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de dos vacas en producción e incrementar sus ganancias en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Ramón de Jesús is 54 years old and has three children. This gentleman is from the area of Chichigalpa, which is in the western region of the country. His town is known for being an area that produces sugar cane and plaintains, and where there is a lot of cattle. 

Ramón works selling milk and plantains. His business is located in his small farm and he also distributes his products on the street. He has twelve years of experience. He was already a farmer when the land reform passed. The government gave him and his family some land, and because of his farming experience and his entreprenurial spirit, he dedicated himself along with his family to make it productive and support his household.

Currently Ramón has dreams and goals, which include expanding his farm in order to work more and increase production, which will increase his household income.

Ramón is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thenks to the help provided he will be able to purchase two producing cows and increase his earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two producing cows so that he may increase his future earnings.

loans.name: Ernestina Del Socorro

texts.es: Ernestina , es una mujer viuda de 52 años de edad ,con tres hijos de 24,22,16 años de los cuales el de 16 años es el que está bajo su responsabilidad y estudia en secundaria .Ernestina ha tenido que luchar día a día para salir adelante con sus hijos. Ernestina es del municipio de chichigalpa que queda al occidente del  país, lugar que se caracteriza por ser zona cañera donde se encuentran los ingenios de caña de azúcar. Ella tiene por negocio una pulpería desde hace  muchos  años. negocio que consisten en vender productos de consumo diario al por menor como: arroz por libra, azúcar por libra, aceite por cuarta, pan, leche de vaca  por litro, bolsitas de shampoo,entre otros. Este negocio lo inicio a raíz que su difunto esposo enfermo de gravedad, lo inicio con fondos propios para mejorar  los ingresos del hogar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos médicos. El financiamiento lo necesita para surtir su pequeño negocio e invertir en productos de consumo diario.
texts.en: Ernestina is a 52 year old woman and has three children who are 24, 22, and 16 years old.  Of her children, only her 16 year old son is still under her care and he studies in the secondary school. Ernestina has had to fight day by day to get ahead with her children. She is from the municipality of Chichigalpa, located in the western part of the country. It is an area known as a sugarcane zone for its sugarcane refineries. She has had a grocery store for many years where she sells products such as rice and sugar by the pound, oil by the quart, bread, cow milk by liter, little bags of shampoo, and other items. She began this business when her deceased husband became ill, and she started it with her own money to improve the household earnings and to help with her husband's medical expenses. She needs the loan to stock her small business and invest in products of daily use.

loans.use: stock her grocery store and invest in products used every day like basic grains and sweets.

loans.name: Mariela Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 33 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño que tiene 11 años el mismo que estudia en colegio. Vive en la casa de sus padres.

Ella es secretaria de una empresa y también se dedica al comercio, vende lencería, perfumes y sabanas; trabaja todos los días en su trabajo y en las ventas ya que les ofrece sus productos a sus compañeros de trabajo y en las noches recorre la ciudad vendiendo a sus conocidos y amigos del sector, entrega la mercadería a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a como prefieran sus clientes. Lo que es perfumes y cremas le envía una tía de los Estados Unidos y la ropa y sabanas compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes, lleva  más de 4 años con este negocio y esto le es  de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante a su hijo que es lo más importante para ella.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa ya que pronto se viene una temporada buena y espera estar preparada. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo y que este sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones (Illusions) community bank meets every other week in the district of El Progreso, city of Portoviejo. This is a very populated urban zone in the city known as the area with the prison since the women's prison of Portoviejo is located here. Mrs. Mariela lives here. She is 33 years old and a single mother to an eleven year old boy who attends school. She lives in her parents' house. She is a business secretary and also works selling lingerie, perfume, and sheets. She works every day at her job and at night sells her products around the city to her acquaintances and friends. She sells a lot of her merchandise on credit and collects every week or every other week according to her customers' preference. The perfumes and lotions are sent to her from an aunt in the United States and she buys the clothing and sheets in Guayaquil once a month. She has been working at this for more than four years and it is a lot of help toward getting ahead with her son.

This loan is to be used to go to Guayaquil to buy clothing since a good season is coming and she wishes to be prepared. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the institution provides her with a lot of assistance. Her dreams are to provide her son with all the best so that he will be successful.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Katty Jasmin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 16 años el mismo que está en colegio. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella  es multifacética ya que se dedica a varias actividades, vende  ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas, además  prepara comida para eventos los fines de semana y da clases dirigidas a niños que necesitan un poco de refuerzo en su escuela. En lo referente al comercio su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días  en las ventas desde las 8 am hasta las 11 y en las noches también por ratos. Entrega sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, ella lleva más de 10 años en sus actividades y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es socia fundadora y secretaria del Banco Comunal, está muy contenta por la ayuda que recibe con cada crédito.
 
Su sueño es que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank 'Ilusiones' meet every fifteen days in the district El Progreso in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a highly populated and marginalized district. It is also known as the prison sector, since this where the women's prison of Portoviejo is located.

Katty, 37, lives in this area.  She is married, and she and her husband have a sixteen-year-old son who is in high school.  Her husband is a public employee.

She is a multifaceted person who is involved in a variety of activities.  She sells clothes and all types of shoes.  She also prepares food for events held on weekends.  Additionally, she holds classes for children who need a little extra reinforcement in their schooling.

She sells her goods door to door, working every day from 8 am to 11 pm, and also works at night on occasion.  She sells her products on credit and collects from her customers every fifteen days.  She buys her products in Guayaquil every time she needs to.  She has been doing this for over ten years, and things are going very well.

She will use this loan to buy clothes and shoes, as well as supplies to prepare her food items.  She is a founding member and the secretary of her communal bank.  She is very grateful for the help that each loan provides her.  Her dream is to see her son have a good professional career.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 33 años, está casada con Teófilo, con quien tiene tres hijos: Morelia de 16, Aymer de 8 y Cristian de 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa arrendada ubicada en un distrito rural.
Como toda madre del campo tiene que distribuir su tiempo para atender a sus hijos y la agricultura. Cultiva arvejas, papas y flores (gladiolos). “Cada 4 meses siembro dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas, de las que cosecho 30 sacos”, menciona. Toda su producción la negocia en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Así también, afirma que con la venta de los gladiolos obtiene más ingresos, por su gran demanda; la venta de estas flores es más beneficiosa en los meses de mayo y noviembre. Sus planes más cercanos son de sembrar más arvejas.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y le agrada el sistema de trabajo, así como las charlas educativas que recibe.
Con este dinero podrá comprar dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas (con 1000 soles), los otros 1000 soles serán para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old, is married to Teófilo, with whom she has 3 children: Morelia who is 16 years old, Aymer who is 8 and Cristian who is 4. They live in a rented house located in a rural district.
Like all mothers in the countryside, Nancy has to manage her time to take care of her children and the crops. She grows peas, potatoes and flowers (gladiolo). "Every 4 months I plant two bags of pea seeds, from which I harvest 30 sacks" she says. She sells all of her produce at the wholesale market in her city. She also says that the sale of gladioli has more profit, as there is greater demand. The sale of these flowers is the most beneficial in the months of May and November. Her short term plans are to plant more peas.

This is her 8th loan with MFP, for which she promises to be punctual with her payment schedule. "Los Picaflores de Patay", or "Hummingbirds of Patay" , is the name of her communal bank and she likes this work system and receiving educational talks.
With these funds she will be able to purchase two sacks of pea seeds(with 1000 soles), and the remaining 1000 soles will be to acquire fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of pea seeds (with 1000 soles), and the remaining 1000 soles would be to obtain fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 54 años, está casada con Raymundo, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con tres de ellos. La casa donde viven es propia, se ubica en una zona rural.
Desde hace 25 años comenzó con el cultivo de papas en sus seis hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, siembra en grandes cantidades, gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos. “El trabajo no es fácil, por eso mi esposo me ayuda mucho, y a veces contrato personal, sino no se puede avanzar”, comenta. Ahora su motivación es brindar estudios a sus tres últimos hijos, quienes están en la ciudad, por lo que tiene una casa arrendada allá, donde también invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias. Por esa razón, se sigue esforzando en el campo y ahora piensa sembrar más papas para iniciar con fuerza en esta temporada.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, donde le agrada participar por las charlas educativas y el trabajo en equipo.
Teresa iniciará una siembra de papas, para ello invertirá la mitad del dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas y la otra mitad en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old and married to Raymundo. Together they have six children, but only three of them currently live at home. They own the house where they live, which is located in a rural area.

Twenty-five years ago, she started growing potatoes on her 15 acres of farmland, thanks to her husband and children's support. "It isn't easy work, but that's why my husband helps me a lot and sometimes I hire workers. It's the only way to advance," she says. Her current motivation is to provide her three youngest children with an education. They are in the city, which is why she has a rented house there where she also invests most of her earnings. That is why she keeps striving on the farm and currently wants to plant more potatoes so that she can start the season strong.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is committed to paying her installments on time. She belongs to the communal bank Trabajemos Unidos, where she enjoys participating in educational trainings and working as a team.

Teresa will start planting more potatoes. In order to do so she will invest half of the money from this loan in the purchase of seeds, and the other half in buying fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Norma Lisset

texts.es:
La señora Norma,  tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que viven con ella, de los cuales solo 2 están estudiando, vive en el Km 17 Arizona, Atlántida.
Su actividad económica es un negocio de pulpería que estableció hace más de un año por medio de su cuñada, la cual le facilito los medios de obtenerlo. Ella vende granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, huevos, embutidos, productos enlatados, etc. Con este negocio ha podido solventar las necesidades básicas de sus hijos y en su hogar, dedicando todo el día a su negocio.
Ella solicita un segundo préstamo con ODEF, el primero fue financiado por Kiva a quien le da las gracias por el apoyo, agradece porque su negocio se ha mantenido activo y sus ventas han mejorado. Con este otro préstamo que es de 7,000 Lempiras ella quiere de igual manera mantenerlo siempre surtido y comprar granos básicos, refrescos y golosinas y obtener más ganancias. Su meta es darles una buena educación a sus hijos, por eso quiere que su negocio se mantenga en crecimiento.
texts.en:
Norma, 47, is a single mother; she has three minor children living with her only two of which are attending school.  She lives at Kilometer 17 in Arizona, Atlántida.  Her economic activity is a grocery store that she opened more than a year ago thanks to her sister-in-law who gave her the means to do so.  She sells basic grains, dairy products, meat, eggs, canned goods, cured meats, etc.  She’s been able to cover her, her children’s and her household’s basic needs by means of this business.

She’s requesting her second ODEF loan.  The first one was financed through Kiva who she thanks for the support.  She’s grateful because her business has remained active and her sales have improved.  She will use this new 7000 Lempira loan  to once again keep her store well-stocked.  She will buy basic grains, soft-drinks and snacks to earn more profits.  Her goal is to provide her children with a good education and this is why she wants her business to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: ENAGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Gérardine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Gérardine et son mari vivent ensemble avec les enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Gérardine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a cinq ans que Gérardine vend des friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Gérardine exerce la couture. Gérardine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Gérardine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Gérardine sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les trois prêts antérieurement reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
ENAGNON is a three-person group where all the members live in the same neighborhood. 

The group representative, Gérardine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 52 years old and is married to Albert. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom go to school. Gérardine and her husband live with their children and take care of their children's various expenses. Gérardine did not go to school. 

Gérardine has been selling second-hand clothing in a market in Benin for five years. Gérardine is also a seamstress. She is passionate about her business, and this allows her to meet her children's needs as well as her own.
