Gérardine buys her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her clients and increase her working capital, Gérardine and the other members of ENAGNON are asking for a fourth loan. This loan will help them better respond to the demands of their clients and to increase profits. Their three previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 24 años, tiene dos hijas, la mayor de 6 años y la más pequeña de 5 meses de nacida. Es una madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres.
En sus 5 años como agricultora se ha dado cuenta que es la actividad que mejor realiza, por eso se esmera mucho en las tareas diarias, pues aun el parto de su última hija no fue impedimento para dirigirse hacia sus cultivos y trabajarlos. “Siempre contrato personal, porque sola no me abastezco en las siembras y cosechas”, menciona. Sus principales sembríos constan de papas, arvejas, maíz y habas, pero da prioridad a los tubérculos, por la demanda. En la libertad del campo, también cría animales, como vacas y carneros, los que vende esporádicamente para cubrir alguna necesidad urgente. Flor está ahorrando todo el dinero necesario para poder lograr sus objetivos, uno de ellos construir su casa propia. Ahora se esmerará en la siembra de papas, aprovechando las lluvias que ya se acercan.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con MFP y está contenta de pertenecer a un grupo sólido de socios activos, “Trabajemos Unidos”, es el nombre de su banco comunal.
Este mes, Flor iniciará una siembra de papas, para ello invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de semillas y fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Flor is 24 years old and has two daughters. The oldest is six years old and the little one is five months old. She is a single mother and lives in her parents' house. 

In her five years as a farmer, she has realized that farming is what she does best, so she puts a great deal of effort into her daily work. Even the birth of her second daughter was not an impediment to taking care of her crops. "I always hire laborers, because I can't keep up with the plantings and harvests alone," she explains. Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas, corn, and fava beans, but she gives priority to the tubers, because of demand. In the freedom of the country, she also raises animals, like cattle and sheep. She sells them sporadically to cover urgent needs. 

Flor is saving all the money she needs to be able to reach her objectives, one of which is to build her own house. Now, she will put her effort into her potato crops, taking advantage of the rains that are already coming.

This is Flor's eighth loan with MFP, and she is happy to belong to a stable group of active members. "Trabajemos Unidos" ["Let's Work Together"] is the name of her communal bank.

This month, Flor will begin a potato planting, for which she will invest the money in the purchase of sacks of seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Mita

texts.en:
Mita is 29 years old and lives with her three daughters and one son who are 10, 8, 5 and 2 years old. She was spending her life with her husband and her four children but unfortunately, she lost her husband in 2011. Since then she has been managing her family with a portable business. She sells biscuits, wafers, toffees, cakes, bread, etc. by roaming in different villages. In this way, she earns 3,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient to manage her big family. She is unable to provide the minimum study materials to her children. She wants to increase her business and set up a shop in her home. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to set up a shop in her home, purchase goods in bulk and add some new varieties of stationery items and snacks for her shop.

loans.use: to establish a shop and purchase biscuits, wafers, toffees, and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Jasoda

texts.en:
Jasoda is a 30-year-old lady who lost her husband in 2005. Since then, she has taken on all the burdens of her family. She lives with her daughter age 16 and her son age 13. After her husband passed away, she became involved in an agriculture activity. This is not sufficient to manage her family, so she purchased a cow. Now she is taking care of her cow and selling milk in the local market. From this business, she earns 2,000 to 2,500 INR per month. She wants to purchase one more cow and continue her milk business. She has one year of experience in this field and she has time to take care of cow. 

Jasoda requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows. She says that this business can strengthen her economic condition and she can pay her children's tuition. She has a dream of educating her children so they can earn for themselves in the future. She does not want her children to face the same kinds of problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 27 años, su pareja es Cecilia, de 23 años, tienen dos hijos; Sarai, de 6 y Tany, de 3 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona rural.
Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, para ello arrienda terrenos donde siembra papa, arveja, habas y otras hortalizas, las que después de cada cosecha las comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. Eduardo le da mayor prioridad al cultivo de papas, porque este tubérculo es muy solicitado si se sabe que proviene de la zona en donde vive. “Cada cosecha la vendo al por mayor y los compradores se lo llevan hasta Lima (ciudad capital)”, menciona. Tiene planeado adquirir sus terrenos propios, por eso viene ahorrando hace mucho.

Este es su préstamo número 9 con MFP y agradece el apoyo, por lo que promete que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, donde se siente a gusto por el trabajo solidario.
Eduardo destinará el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 20 sacos de semillas de papa (con 1500 soles). Lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos y guano.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 27 years old. He has a wife Cecilia who is 23 years old, and they have two children: Sarai, who is six years old; and Tany, who is three years old. The family lives together in their own home in a rural location. 
Five years ago he started working in agriculture, leasing land where he plants potatoes, peas, beans, and other vegetables. After each harvest he sells these in the central market in the city. Eduardo focuses primarily on the cultivation of potatoes as this tuber is highly sought after if the customer knows it comes from the local region. "Every harvest is sold wholesale and the buyers then take them to Lima (the capital city)," Eduardo adds. He plans to buy his own land, and he has been saving money for some time now. 
This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is grateful for the assistance. He promises to make prompt monthly payments. He belongs to the communal bank "Working Together," where he takes pride in the communal work. 
Eduardo will use the funds from this loan to purchase 20 sacks of potato seed (1500 soles), and the remaineder he will use to purchase organic fertilizer and guano.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of potato seed (1500 soles) and the remainder he will use to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Piedad Mirena

texts.es: Piedad tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella reside en el Barrio El Colegio, Gualaco, Olancho. Inicio su negocio hace 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y lo atiende de lunes a domingo, desde las 7:00 am y culmina a las 6:30 pm. Las dificultades del negocio es el alto costo de la canasta básica y a la falta de ingreso de las personas ya que es una causa de que bajen las ventas. El préstamo que Piedad solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, carnes, frijoles, jabón, detergentes, huevos, dulces, refrescos, entre otros.  Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Las metas que tiene Piedad para su negocio es ir haciéndolo cada día más grande. Este es su primer financiamiento en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Piedad is 25 years old, and she is single with no children.  She lives in the neighborhood El Colegio in Gualcao, Olancho.  She started her grocery store five years ago.  Her store is located in her home, and she operates it seven days a week from 7:00 am to 6:30 pm.  The difficulties facing her business include the high cost of goods and the lack of personal income among her customers.  Both of these factors have resulted in a decrease in sales.  

She is seeking this loan so she can purchase products such as rice, sugar, meats, beans, soap, detergent, eggs, sweets, soft drinks and other items.  With the help of this loan she will be able to supply her business and offer her customers everything they need.  Her goal is to continue to expand her business day by day.  This is her first loan with FAMA, and she hopes to be able to repay her loan in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with six children and shares a six-room house with her family. In the past she faced many challenges including sickness and death. She lacked the money to provide her children with an education and enough food for her family.

Sarah presently operates a cosmetics store in Mbengwi, Camaroon. Because her store has been open for a number of years and is in a good location, she is optimistic that it will continue to succeed. Cosmetics stores are scarce in her neighborhood and so she enjoys a high patronage from the increasing population. She sells her goods at moderate prices and ensures her stocks remain steady. She also notes that the community will benefit by not having to go to Bamenda to shop.

Sarah joined GHAPE in 2004, preferring its loans because of moderate interest rates and convenient repayment schedules. She also comments that members are encouraged to save to undertake bigger investments by giving them interest on their savings. She has taken and repaid loans five times and promises that if granted this 200,000 XAF loan, she will use it to expand her shop with more body lotions and bath soap, plus earrings, chains and shoes.

Sarah’s life is now a success story. She can boast of owning a cosmetics shop, educating her children and providing medicine and three square meals a day for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Combelle

texts.fr: Revendeuse de mèches et cartes de recharges depuis 2010, Madame Combele est une jeune dame de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un électricien et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Son activité se fait à domicile et elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Avec ce premier prêt qu’elle sollicite, elle va s’acheter des mèches et des cartes de recharge  afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. A l'avenir, elle veut devenir grossiste.
texts.en: A retailer of hair extensions and phone recharge cards since 2010, Combelle is a young 31-year-old woman. She is married to an electrician and has no children to support. She works from home and her supplies come from Lomé. With this first loan, she is going to buy hair extensions and phone recharge cards in response to the needs of her customers. In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres, a quienes cuida con cariño. 
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los 19 años. Aprendió sobre la actividad de sus padres, cuenta que a pesar de las diversas dificultades que encontró en la actividad agrícola, le gusta mucho el campo.  La siembra de papa es su principal actividad, aunque también cultiva arvejas.
Casi todas las mañanas se dirige hacia sus sembríos para cultivarlos y atenderlos; “hay que regar, abonar y limpiar a cada rato, sino no, no producen bien”, menciona. Para más adelante tiene pensado comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que por ahora arrienda tres parcelas. Trabajará con mucho ahínco para lograr su objetivos, por eso acude a MFP.

Este es su préstamo número 11 y está muy agradecido con la entidad por la oportunidad de progreso, por eso dice que pagará las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, donde es el tesorero y se siente identificado con el grupo.
Fredy comprará 10 bolsas de semillas de papa y varias bolsas de fertilizantes. Invertirá todo el dinero en esta compra.
texts.en:
Fredy, 28, is single living with his parents who he cares for with much love.  He’s been working in agriculture since the age of 19.  He learned this activity from his parents.  He states that despite the  various economic difficulties found in agriculture, he likes working in the fields very much.  His main activity is growing potatoes although he also grows peas.

He heads out to his fields almost every morning to care for his crops.  He mentions that he has to water, fertilize and clear weeds all the time because if he doesn’t crop yields won’t be good.  He plans for later on to buy his own farmland because for now he’s leasing three parcels.  He will work very focused to obtain his goals and this is why he’s calling on MFP.

This is loan #11 and he’s very grateful to MFP for the opportunity of progress he’s getting and this is why he says that he will make his installment payments punctually.  He belongs to the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank and he’s the treasurer; he feels much identified with the group.  

Fredy will buy 10 bags of potato seeds and several bags of fertilizer.  He will invest all of the money in this purchase.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potato seeds and several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Samuel fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe /Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «ensemble comme une seul personne». Il a 43 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 3 ans à 16 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Samuel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait devenir le grand distributeur de riz dans des pays voisin. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Samuel is a member of the Abishyizehamwe /Rsz group. The name of the group means "Together as one person". Samuel is 43 years old and married with five children between between the ages of 3 and 16. Four of his children attend school. Samuel has six years of primary level education and is a rice farmer. 

This is his 3rd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. In order to expand his rice-growing business, he plans to request other loans so that he can increase his agricultural operation. 

In the years ahead, Samuel would like to be one of the best rice producers in the neighboring countries. He plans to use the profits to pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Rocio Carolina

texts.es: Rocío, tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su esposo, hijos y su madre. Ella realiza su propia actividad económica de donde obtiene los ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Rocío vende ropa nueva y usada como Jeans, blusas, sandalias y ropa interior de mujer. Su negocio es ambulante y por pedidos, tiene 3 años de realizar esta actividad dedicándole la mayor parte de su tiempo. Solicita a ODEF un segundo préstamo por 6,400 Lempiras para comprar más mercadería y tener variedad de ropa. Con esta inversión incrementara sus ventas y tendrá mas clientes. Su meta es establecer su negocio en un local fijo y en un lugar estratégico, y sueña que sus hijos tengan un título universitario.
texts.en: Rocío, 33, is married and has two children.  She lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida with her husband, children and her mother.  She carries out her own economic activity to earn income to support her family.  Rocío sells used and new clothes like jeans, blouses, sandals and women’s underwear.  Her business is ambulatory and based on prior orders.  She’s been in business three years and she spends most of her time in it.  She’s requesting a 6400 Lempira loan from ODEF, her second loan, to buy more merchandise in order to have a variety of clothes.  Her sales will increase with this investment and she’ll have more customers.  Her goal is to set up the business in a fixed locale located in a strategic spot and she dreams with her children attaining university degrees.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothes, sandals and women's underwear to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.fr: Ruth est une femme de 40 ans commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise depuis 01 an dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock de poissons en achetant en carton ainsi que ses condiments.Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 40-year-old woman.  She is involved in retail business and has been selling braised fish for one year in a neighborhood of the capital city.

Thanks to her good experience in this field and to the fact that her prices are reasonable, she has been able to build an increasingly large and faithful customer base.

However, she is now requesting a loan, since she can no longer meet her customers' needs, because of her small capital.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her stock of fish (which she will be buying in boxes) and condiments.

The profits generated through this loan will be partly reinvested in her activity, while the rest will be saved toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy crates of fish and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 55 años, está casada con Pascual, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con uno de ellos.
Hace más de 35 años abrió una panadería donde trabaja con su esposo y donde sus hijos apoyaban mientras vivían con ella.  La mayoría de los habitantes de su localidad compran panes y pasteles en su negocio. Todos la conocen como una madre responsable, ya que su jornada de trabaja inicia a las 2 de la madrugada, para obtener panes calientes y frescos al amanecer. Ya está acostumbrada a la rutina y en todo este tiempo mejoró su receta, por eso también prepara bizcochuelos, panetones y panes de diversas variedades y tamaños. Pero a Luzmila también le gusta tejer, por eso también se dedica al tejido y bordado, sus 20 años de experiencia en este oficio se reflejan en su pequeña tienda de artesanía que tiene en el parque central de su localidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo, y por lo que promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Luzmila invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de harina, mantequilla, manteca, aceite, azúcar y otros insumos para preparar los panes.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 55 years old, is married to Pascual. They have six children, but only one still lives with them.

Thirty-five years ago, she opened a bakery, where she works with her husband. The children also helped while they lived at home. The majority of her town buys bread and pastries from her business. They all know her as a responsible mother. Her workday starts at 2am, in order to have hot, fresh bread in the morning. By now, she is used to the routine and throughout the years, she has improved her recipe. She also makes sponge cake, Peruvian pantone bread, and other types of bread in different sizes and varieties. Luzmila also likes to knit, so she also works in knitting and embroidering. Her 20 years of experience in this work is reflected in her small craft store, which is near the town's central park.

Luzmila belongs to the Telarmachay communal bank and this is her sixth loan with MFP. She feels grateful for the help, and therefore promises to be punctual in making her payments. She will invest the money in buying sacks of flour, butter, lard, cooking oil, sugar, and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, butter, lard, cooking oil, sugar, and other ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo tiene 54 años, está casado con Domitila, tiene dos hijas: Roxana y Viviana. La casa donde viven es alquilada.
Él se dedica a la venta de combustibles como: gasolina, petróleo y kerosene. Para ello acondicionó un puesto de ventas en su vivienda. Hace 4 años empezó con este negocio y como los transportistas circulan con frecuencia por la zona, requieren de combustible. Justo es el único que ofrece este servicio. Además se dedica a la confección de tejidos, al lado de su esposa, así obtiene ingresos extras que el permiten cubrir otros gastos. Él tiene una meta, construir su casa propia, por ello trabaja arduamente para obtener los ahorros suficientes y empezar con su proyecto. 

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz del trabajo realizado en todo este tiempo. Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
El dinero de este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de un cilindro de gasolina, medio cilindro de kerosene y embudos para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio, 54, is married to Domitila and has two daughters: Roxana and Viviana.  He rents his house.  He sells fuels like gasoline, petroleum and kerosene.  To do so he set up a sales point at home.  He started this business four years  ago because vehicle drivers who circulate in the area frequently need fuel.  Justo is the only one offering this service.  He also weaves textiles with his wife thus earning extra income to cover other expenses.  His goal is to build a house of his own and this is why he works so hard to save up enough money to start this project.

He belongs to the “Telarmachay” communal bank and this is his 5th MFP loan.  He feels happy with all the work he’s accomplished to date.  He mentions that he will be very punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a cylinder of gasoline, half a cylinder of kerosene and funnels to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, kerosene and funnels.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy, 45 years old, lives with her husband and baby in Kampong Cham province, where they own a small piece of farmland upon which they cultivate rice. To add to their income, this couple also sells firewood, collecting their supplies from the nearby forest and purchasing from the wood industry, using a horse-pulled trailer which her husband also uses to provide transportation service to local people. Active in their businesses for over 10 years, they generate a suitable income of 20,000 KHR each day for their family.

Tuy is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay the outstanding balance owed to her supplier, from whom she bought a horse. She appreciates that Kiva lenders help her family make improvements to their current businesses. She hopes for more profit in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the outstanding balance to her supplier, from whom she bought a horse.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda tiene 30 años, su pareja es Julián, con quien tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 4 años. Esta familia habita en una casa propia en un distrito netamente agrícola.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde adolescente, ya que apoyaba a sus padres en las faenas del campo. Al formar su familia también decidió dedicarse a lo mismo, pues le agrada el cuidado de sus cultivos. Los suelos de su localidad son excelentes para la producción de distintas variedades de papa, por eso, en cada temporada invierte en semillas, fertilizantes y mano de obra, ya que sabe que los resultados serán satisfactorios. Realiza las ventas en su misma localidad, aunque considera que es más rentable en la ciudad, por la mayor cantidad de compradores que llegan. Sus planes son de sembrar más papa en esta temporada, ya que se acerca la primavera. 

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por esa razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Su banco comunal se llama “Trabajemos Unidos” y es uno de los grupos más antiguos y ejemplares de la zona.
El dinero de este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de 10 sacos de semillas de papa, lo que resta lo empleará en la compra de fertilizantes y guano de corral.
texts.en:
Rosenda is 30 years old.  Her partner is Julián, with whom she has three children aged 4, 7 and 11.  The family lives in their own home in a heavily agricultural area.

She has been a farmer since she was a teenager, and she used to support her parents in their work in the fields.  Upon forming her own family, she also decided to continue to work in agriculture, since she enjoys caring for her crops.  The local soil is excellent for growing distinct varieties of potato.  Thus, every season she invests in seed potatoes and fertilizers, and she pays laborers to help work the fields.  She knows that she will obtain satisfactory results each year.  She sells her crops in the same area, even though she thinks that it is more profitable to sell in the city due to the larger number of buyers there.  Her plan is to plant more potatoes this season, since the spring is approaching.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She gives her word that she will be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  Her communal bank is called “Trabajemos Unidos” ("United We Work"), and it is one of the oldest and most solid groups in the area.

She will use the loan proceeds to buy 10 sacks of seed potatoes.  The remainder will be used to by fertilizers and manure.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of seed potatoes.  The remainder will be used to by fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 33 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres.
Estudió la carrera de Farmacia en un instituto reconocido de la localidad, pero sus deseos son consolidarse en un negocio propio, por ello hace 5 años comenzó a dedicar su tiempo y sus fuerzas en la agricultura. En los terrenos de sus padres siembra una variedad de productos, como arvejas, papa y flores. Gracias a la agricultura obtuvo las ganancias que le permitieron comprase un auto, con el que también realiza servicio de transporte y además instaló una pequeña botica en su vivienda. Ahora, consiente de que el precio de venta de los productos en el mercado central de la ciudad son los mejores, desea optimizar la calidad de sus productos. Por eso comenzó a buscar tierras nuevas y descansadas para obtener mejores frutos. “La agricultura es rentable si se trabaja con esmero”, menciona. Esta vez invertirá en una siembra de arvejas.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es su octavo crédito con MFP, promete que pagará con responsabilidad las cuotas mensuales.
Wilfredo invertirá este dinero en la compra de cuatro sacos de semillas de arvejas (con 2000) soles, y fertilizantes con el dinero restante.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 33, is single living in his parents’ house.  He studied pharmacy in a well-known local institute but he wants to become established in his own business  which is why five years ago he started investing his time and strength into agriculture.  He plants a variety of products like peas, corn and flowers, in his parents’ land.  Thanks to agriculture he earned profits that made it possible for him to buy a car that he also uses to  provide transportation services; he also opened a small drug store at home.  Now, aware that market prices for his products in the local market are at their best, he wants to optimize the quality of his products which is why he’s looking for new, rested land to grow more crops.  He mentions that agriculture is profitable as long as one works hard.  On this occasion he will invest in a pea crop.

He belongs to the “Picaflores de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank and this is his 8th MFP loan.  He promises to make his monthly payments responsibly.  Wilfredo will use this money to buy four sacks of pea seeds (2000 soles) and will buy fertilizer with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of pea seeds and fertilizer..

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 36 años, su pareja es Gregorio, de 35 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro aun estudian. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en zona rural.
Ella lleva casi 20 años en la actividad de la agricultura al lado de su esposo. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, en los que pasa la mayor parte del día, su principal cultivo es la papa, en sus diferentes variedades. La comercialización de sus productos la realiza en el mercado central de la ciudad, donde le ofrecen un buen precio por su producción. Una de sus metas es seguir ahorrando para adquirir más terrenos de cultivo y aumentar su producción. Ahora iniciará una siembra de papas.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, un grupo sólido que según dice, la sacó de muchos apuros económicos.
Con este dinero podrá adquirir 10 sacos de semillas de papa y la otra mitad será para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Viviana is 36 years old and her husband, Gregorio, is 35.  Together they have five children, five of whom are still students.  All of them live in the house they own, which is located in a rural area.

Viviana has spent nearly twenty years working in agriculture alongside her husband.  Her life is focused on caring for their land, where she spends most of her day.  Their main crop is potatoes  of different varieties.  Their products are sold in the city’s central market, where they are offered a good price for their produce.  One of their goals is to continue saving in order to acquire more land for cultivation and to thereby increase production.  They have just begun to plant a new crop of potatoes.

This is Viviana’s 11th loan with Kiva partner MFP and she gives her word that she will be punctual in paying monthly installments.  She is a member of the communal bank “Working Together,”  a solid group that has saved her from many financial hardships.

With this loan, she will purchase ten bags of potato seeds and fertilizers with the other half.

loans.use: to acquire ten bags of potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bequer

texts.es:
Bequer tiene 21 años, es soltero, viven con sus padres en una casa alquilada.
Luego de terminar sus estudios en la capital del país, regresó a su ciudad natal donde comenzó a trabajar en una fábrica textil, ahí aprendió todo lo necesario en este rubro. Ya lleva cerca de 5 años en la confección de prendas de vestir (polos, camisetas y ropa deportiva), para ello adquirió unas máquinas de coser que facilitan su trabajo. Ya cuenta con una máquina de costura recta y luego piensa comprar más maquinaria para mejorar su taller. 

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde está seguro podrá concretar sus objetivos, razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.  
Bequer invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de varios metros de diferentes telas, para continuar con la confección de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Bequer is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in a rented house.

After finishing his studies in the capital city, he returned to his hometown where he began to work in a textile factory, where he learned everything he needs in this field. It was about about five years of making clothing (polos, shirts and sportswear) before he acquired some sewing machines to help in his work. He has a straight stitch machine and he is thinking of buying more machines later to improve his workshop.

He belongs to the communal bank Telarmachay and this is his third loan through MFP and he is is sure he can achieve his goals, and this is why he promises to make his payments on time.

Bequer will invest the money from the loan to buy several yards of different fabrics in order to continue making clothing.

loans.use: to buy several yards of different fabrics in order to continue making clothing to sell

loans.name: Meslem

texts.en:
Meslem is from Iraq.  He is a 25-year-old youth client, and is married with three children.  He is the only provider for the family.

Meslem owns a small grocery store and sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks.  He established his business in 2009 and has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to install shelves and buy refrigerators for his store.  He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install shelves and buy refrigerators for his grocery store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 50 años, está casada con Antonio, con quien tiene tres hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos. La casa donde viven es propia, ubicada en una zona rural.
La agricultura es su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años, hizo posible que pagara los estudios superiores de sus hijos, los cuales la visitan constantemente y se siente feliz de tener el amor de sus nietos, a los que consiente mucho. Sus principales cultivos son: flores (gladiolos), arvejas y papas, los que cuida y abona; pues sabe que de eso depende la buena venta en cada cosecha. Normalmente los vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pero dependiendo de la calidad, los lleva a la capital del país donde le pagan mayor precio. “Sembrar arvejas y gladiolos es muy rentable, lo bueno es que se cosechan en 4, 5 o 6 meses”, menciona. Ahora iniciará una siembra de arvejas, pues se acercan los días de lluvias y serán muy beneficiosos.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, donde espera el apoyo para continuar con sus objetivos. 
Yolanda invertirá este dinero en la compra de cuatro sacos de semilla de arvejas (con 2000 soles), lo restante lo destinará en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 50, is married to Antonio and they have three children but only one of them still lives with them.  She owns her house located in a rural zone.

Agriculture has been her main economic activity for the last 20 years.  It made it possible for her to pay for her children’s higher education costs.  They visit her constantly and she feels happy to have her grandchildren’s love; she pampers them very much.

Her main crops are flowers (gladioli), peas and corn that she cares for and fertilizes because she knows that the good sale of harvests depends on this.  She usually sells in the city’s wholesale market but depending on their quality she might take them to the capital where she gets better prices.  She mentions that planting peas and gladioli is very profitable and the good thing is that they are harvested in 4, 5 or six months.  She will now start a pea crop because the rainy season is approaching and that will be very beneficial.

She belongs to the “Picaflores de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank and this is her 7th MFP loan.  She hopes for support to continue towards her objectives.  Yolanda will use this money to buy four bags of pea seeds (2000 soles) and will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor, 48 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. Her eldest daughter is employed and her other daughter studies at the secondary school. Her husband used to work with a construction company.

Assisted by her husband, Dolgor has been running a fruit retailing business since 2000. Early in 2012, they bought land and began growing organic vegetables such is potatoes, carrots, turnip and cabbage. The business is now the sole source of income for the family, and Dolgor says, ''We need to transport our products to Ulaanbaatar, because the season is coming and there will be more customers to purchase organic vegetables." She is therefore requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to transport her organic vegetable to Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.use: to transport her organic vegetables to Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married, and has five children. One of his children works and contributes to the family income.

Jaafar owns a car repair shop. He established his business in 1994 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2000 as a loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 26 years old. He is married and together they have two children. He sells calling cards and SIM cards (personal identification cards). He has been in the business for the past two years with good income.

This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of calling cards and phone accessories to stock in his shop.

He hopes to expand his business and open a branch in Nakuru

loans.use: to purchase stock of calling cards and phone accessories

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51, está casado con Hilda, de 44 años, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: David de 14 y Verónica de 12 años. Juan y su familia viven en una casa rústica, pero propia.
Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de papa en sus diferentes variedades. Cuando sus productos están listos para ser cosechados, los empaqueta y vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. También produce arvejas y habas, porque los precios son buenos. “Las papas de esta zona son bien ricas y lo que le gusta a la gente es la variedad de colores y sabores”, manifiesta como uno de los secretos de sus inmediatas ventas. Las principales variedades que cultiva son: “Yungay” y “Perricholi”, desde muchos años atrás, pero comenta que el trabajo es muy cansado y la inversión es fuerte, especialmente si se siembra en distintas partes, como él lo hace. Juan es hombre constante y responsable, por eso se dedica con esmero en lo que realiza.  

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y como en ocasiones anteriores promete que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, donde es el secretario y se siente a gusto con su equipo de trabajo.
Con este dinero podrá adquirir 20 sacos de semillas de papa de la variedad “Yungay” (con 1000 soles). Lo restante será para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old and is married to Hilda, who is 44. They have six children, but now only two of them live at home: David, who is 14, and Veronica who is 12.  Juan and his family live in a rustic house, but it is their own home.

He has worked for over 20 years as a farmer, growing potatoes of different varieties.  When his crops are ready for harvest, he packs them and sells them in the central market of the city.  He also grows peas and beans, because the prices are good.  "The potatoes from this area are very tasty, and the people like the variety of colors and flavors", he says, explaining the secret to his quick sales.  For many years, the main varieties he has cultivated are "Yungay" and "Perricholi".  He adds that the work is very tiring and requires a lot of investment, especially if the crops are planted in distinct areas, as they are in his case.

Juan is an earnest and responsible man, and he puts a great deal of care into what he does. This is his 11th loan with MFP, and as always he will be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He belongs to the communal bank “Trabajemos Unidos”, where he is the secretary.  He is pleased to be working with the other members. 

He will use the loan proceeds to purchase 20 sacks of seed potatoes of the variety "Yungay" (using 1,000 Peruvian soles).  The remainder will be used to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of seed potatoes of the variety "Yungay" (using 1,000 Peruvian soles).  The remainder will be used to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is 26 years old and married with one child aged four years. She has been in the green tea leaves selling business for the last five years earning approximately KES.15,000 monthly. 

She has a good credit history with KADET MFI and she is applying for her fifth loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She has borrowed KES. 20,000 which she plans to use to purchase more stock of green tea leaves for resale. 

With the anticipated profits she plans repay her loan and support her family. She hopes to venture into large-scale tea leaves selling.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Rolin

texts.es:
Rolin tiene 22 años, su pareja es Dora, con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años. La casa donde viven es alquilada.
Él es un joven padre muy trabajador, su hijo es su inspiración, por ello hace 3 años que se dedica a sembrar distintas variedades de papa en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los que heredó de sus padres, pero no son muy amplios, por lo que también trabaja también en asociación con otros agricultores. Además, en sus tiempos libres trabaja como peón para otros sembríos, con las ganancias que obtiene ahorra lo máximo, pues planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Sus objetivos son claros, primero construirá su casa propia y luego ampliará sus sembríos. Por ahora seguirá trabajando en el campo para seguir ahorrando.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con MFP, por lo que da su palabra de pagar a tiempo los pagos mensuales, como lo hizo anteriormente. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, y le agrada el sistema de trabajo solidario.
Rolin cuenta con semillas de papa, por eso destinará los 2000 soles en la compra de varias bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Rolin is 22 years old. His wife is Dora, with whom he has one two-year-old son. They rent the house they live in.

He is a very hardworking young father. His son is his inspiration; that's why for the last three years, he has been growing different varieties of potatoes in his own agricultural fields. He inherited the fields from his parents, but they aren't very big, so he also farms in association with other farmers. In addition, in his free time, he works as a laborer on other crops. 

He saves as much of the money he earns as possible, and he plans to buy more fields. His goals are clear: first, to build his own house, and later, to increase his plantings. For now, he will continue working in the fields so he can keep saving.

This is Rolin's fourth loan with MFP, so he gives his word that he will make his monthly payments on time, as he has done before. He belongs to the communal bank "Trabajemos Unidos" ["Let's Work Together"], and he is happy with the supportive work system.

Rolin has potato seed, so he will spend the 2000 soles (PEN) on the purchase of several bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy several bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Kailasha

texts.en:
Kailash is 45 years old and a physically challenged person living with his wife and his one daughter aged 8. He is involved in bamboo weaving. He makes baskets and house decorating items from bamboo. As it is a family occupation he has been involved in this activity since his childhood.  He is making these items and sells them in the market three times a month. He goes to a market which is 8 kilometers from his village to sell his bamboo products. From this business he earns 2,500 to 3,000 INR per month. 

Kailash has requested a loan of 20,000 INR from People’s Forum to buy bamboo in large amounts which will help to produce more finished products and construct a house at the market. He says the profit from his business will help to strengthen his financial status. He can fulfill the necessities of his daughter’s education.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bamboo in large quantity for his bamboo weaving business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 38 años, está casada con Luis, con quien tienen tres hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la construyeron con años de ahorro y esfuerzo, se ubica en una zona rural.
Al lado de Luis, siembra papa, olluco, arvejas y habas, cuenta con terrenos agrícolas propios, los que gracias a su trabajo en conjunto lograron adquirir.  Ya son 13 años los que lleva como agricultora y en todo este tiempo ha sabido afrontar los malos momentos, como pérdidas de cosechas enteras; pero también vivió momentos reconfortantes, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias. Para más adelante desea ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir un camión y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de trasporte que realizan hacia el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde lleva a comercializar su cosecha. Sus planes más próximos son de sembrar arvejas, habas y flores (gladiolos). 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP. En su grupo es una socia trabajadora y muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Angélica invertirá este dinero en la compra de semillas de arvejas, flores y habas, ya que iniciará una siembra triple.
texts.en:
Angélica, 38, is married to Luis; they have three children. They own their house that they built thanks to years of work and saving; it’s located in a rural zone.

Alongside Luis, she grows potatoes, olluco [Andean tuber], peas and lima beans.  She own farmland that they were able to acquire through their joint work.  She’s been working in agriculture for 13 years now and she’s faced bad times during these years like the loss of entire crops but she’s also had comforting moments when profits were very good.  For later on she’d like to save enough money to buy a truck to minimize the cost of transporting to the city wholesale market where she goes to sell her crops.  Her short-term goal is to plant peas, lima beans and flowers (gladioli).

She belongs to the “Picaflores de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank and this is her 6th MFP loan.  She’s a very hardworking, very punctual with installment payments group member.  Angélica will use this money to buy pea, flower and lima bean seeds because she’s going to start a triple planting.

loans.use: to buy pea, flower and lima bean seeds.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo tiene 42 años, su pareja es Teodosia, con quien tiene dos hijos: Noemí de 20 y Ángel de 16 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona rural.
Él se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arvejas dos veces al año, ya que la variedad que produce se cosecha cada 6 meses. Por otro lado, afirma que es más rentable la venta de flores (gladiolos). “Me conviene sembrar flores porque se invierte poco dinero en fertilizantes y sus precios de venta son buenos”, dice. Todo esto lo aprendió en sus más de 20 años como agricultor. De todas maneras no descuida sus otros cultivos. Sus metas se enfocan en adquirir más terrenos agrícolas para ampliar su producción.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete  a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay” y se siente contento de formar parte de un grupo de socios empeñosos.
Medardo tiene las semillas de arvejas y gladiolos, por ello invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes para dichos productos.
texts.en:
Medardo is 42-years-old and his spouse is Teodosia; they have two children, Noemí, 20 and Angélica, 16.  This family lives in their own house located in a rural zone.

He works in agriculture.  He plants peas twice a year since the variety he plants is harvested every six months.  On the other hand, he states that the sale of flowers (gladioli) is very profitable so he says that it’s to his advantage to plant flowers because little money has to be invested in fertilizer and their sale price is good.  He’s learned all this over twenty years working as a farmer.  He does not neglect his other crops.  His goals are focused on acquiring more farmland to expand production.

This is his 8th MFP loan so he’s committed to being punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He belongs to the “Picaflores de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank and he’s happy to be part of such a hardworking group of members.

Medardo already has the pea and gladiola seeds so will use this money to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Tukuna

texts.en:
Tukuna is a 30-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents. He runs an electronics repair shop in his village from which he earns 4,000 INR per month. He has 12 years of experience in this field and established his shop 4 years ago. He repairs televisions, radios, fans, Digital Versatile Discs, Versatile Compact Discs and grinders, etc. He goes to market to fetch the required spare parts to repair the electronic machinery. As a physically challenged person it is difficult for him to go to market very frequently, and for that reason he is not able to provide the services to his customers on time. He wants to purchase the spare parts in bulk and keep them in his shop; that will help him to repair the machinery. 

Tukuna has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase spare parts like picture tubes, sensors, remotes, lens, etc., in bulk which will help him to repair the electronic machines on time, reduce his market visits, provide better service to his customers and increase his client base. He says he will earn 6000 to 7000 INR per month from this business. He hopes to get married and build a better concrete house for his family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing spare parts like picture tubes, sensors, remotes, lens, etc. for his repair shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 37 años, está casada con Nildo, con quien tiene dos hijas: Mayli y Gabriela. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en un zona rural.
Tiene cerca de 8 años dedicándose a la siembra de flores (gladiolos), arveja, papa y zanahoria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar sus cosechas, ya que puede ver el fruto de tanto esfuerzo. Una vez al mes viaja a la capital del país a comercializar las flores. “Sembrar de todo es rentable, al cosechar cada producto, en cada mes, se obtiene ganancias y así se pueden cubrir los principales gastos”, menciona.  Se acerca la temporada de siembra de arvejas, por eso requiere de ayuda, porque no quiere quedarse atrás.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, menciona que pagará las cuotas con responsabilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, donde se siente a gusto por tener socios cuyas metas son similares. 
Con este dinero, Esther comprará cuatro bolsas de semillas de arvejas (con 2000 soles). Lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Esther is 37 and is married to Nildo.  They have two daughters: Mayli and Gabriela.  The family lives in their own home, which is located in a rural area.

She has around eight years of experience planting flowers (gladiolas), peas, potatoes and carrots.  What she likes best about her work is that she is able to sell her harvests and see the fruit of all of her effort.  Once a month she goes to the capital of the country to sell her flowers.  

"All of my crops are profitable and every month I obtain income and am thus able to cover my main expenses," she says.  The season for planting peas is approaching, and she needs financial support for this activity, because she doesn't want to fall behind.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She says that she will be responsible in making her repayments on time.  She belongs to the communal bank “Los Picaflores de Patay”, where she is glad to work with members who have goals that are similar to her own.

She will use the loan proceeds to purchase four sacks of peas for planting (using 2,000 soles).  The remainder will be used to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of peas for planting (using 2,000 soles).  The remainder will be used to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Régine

texts.fr: Régine est une femme âgée de 51 ans, celibataire et mère d'un enfant âgé de 18 ans qui va à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale où elle les vivres frais (plantains) et secs (arachides et haricots) en fonction des saisons depuis 4 ans.Son dynamisme et sa sympathie lui ont attiré une clientèle considérable au fil du temps. Suite au déséquilibre ente l'offre et la demande, elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter les stocks de ses marchandises (sac de haricot et arachides) qui lui permettra de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle exigente. Ce crédit l'aidera à augmenter son capital, ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Les bénéfices générés par crédit lui permettront de continuer à financer les études de son fils, de réinvestir et diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Régine is a single woman, 51 years old and the mother of an eighteen year old child who attends school. She is a trader in a market of a district of the capital city, where she has been trading fresh food (plantains) and dried food (peanuts and beans) according to season for four years. Her friendly and dynamic approach has earned her a significant customer base over time. 
Given the imbalance between supply and demand, she is seeking a loan to increase her stock of merchandise (beans and peanuts) to help her meet the needs of her demanding customers. This loan will increase her working capital, her sales and therefore her profit margin.
The profits generated by the loan will allow her to continue funding her son's education, and to invest in and diversify her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of peanuts and beans

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 41 años, está casada con Fernando, de 42 años, tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona rural.
La actividad económica que desempeña es la agricultura, hace 10 años que se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra papa y arveja, las que después de cada cosecha, comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. “Si me gusta trabajar en el campo, a veces hay pérdidas, pero todo depende de las atenciones que se le dé a los cultivos”, menciona. Ahora se esmerará en las próximas siembras, porque una de sus metas es comprar más terrenos agrícolas donde puede obtener mejores ganancias. 

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y está muy agradecida por la confianza de tantos años, por eso no duda en pagar con responsabilidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, donde es una socia puntual y participativa. 
Margarita ya inició su siembra de papas, por eso invertirá todo este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes y guano de corral.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 41, is married to 42 year old Fernando, and they have four children.  They live together in their own house in a rural zone.

She is a farmer.  She has been taking care of her fields, where she grows potatoes and peas, for ten years.  She sells the potatoes and peas after every harvest at the central market in the city.  “Yes, I like to work in the field.  At times there are losses, but everything depends upon the attention given to the crops,” she says.

She will now work very hard on the next plantings.  This is because one of her goals is to buy more agricultural land where she is able to get better income.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the trust during so many years.  Therefore, she will undoubtedly make her payments responsibly.  

She belongs to the “Trabajemos Unidos” [Let's Work Together] communal bank, where she is a punctual member and an active participant.

Margarita has already started planting her potatoes.  Therefore, she will use all of the money to buy various sacks of fertilizers and guano from farmyard birds.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of fertilizers and guano from farmyard birds.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio tiene 34 años, su pareja es Maribel, de 28 años, tienen cuatro hijos, todos aun menores de edad. Esta familia habita en su casa propia, en un distrito agrícola.
Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde niño, por ello, cuando estableció su propia familia, ya tenía experiencia en la agricultura. Comenzó a cultivar papa, de todas las variedades y cada cosecha realizada la comercializa en el mercado central de la capital del país, donde obtiene mejores ganancias. “Antes prefería vender las papas en mi ciudad, pero es más rentable si viajo hasta la ciudad de Lima”, menciona orgulloso. Por esa razón trabaja con esmero porque quiere adquirir una camioneta para trasladarse con mayor facilidad, no solo a la capital, también a otras ciudades del país, ya que Ignacio quiere ser un comerciante mayorista. 

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP, promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos Unidos”, del que siente agradecimiento por la ayuda dentro del grupo.
Con este dinero, Ignacio comprará semillas de papas de la variedad “Yungay” (con 1500 soles) y bolsas de fertilizantes con lo restante.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 34-years-old and his spouse is Maribel, 28; they have four children, all minors.  This family lives in their own house in an agricultural district.

His parents taught him to work the land since he was a boy and when he started his own family he already had experience in agriculture.  He started growing all varieties of potatoes and sells each one of his harvests in the central market in the nation’s capital where profits are better.  He proudly says that he used to prefer selling his potatoes in his own city but it’s more profitable if he goes to Lima to do so.  Because of this he works hard because he wants to buy a pick-up truck to get around more easily not just going to the capital but also to other cities in the country because Ignacio wants to become a wholesaler.

This is his 7th MFP loan and he promises to be punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He belongs to the “Trabajemos Juntos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank and he feels very grateful for the support within the group.  Ignacio will use this money to buy Yungay variety potato seeds (1500 soles) and sacks of fertilizer with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has a spare parts shop in Naivasha town and has operated it for the last three years. He is 36 years old and married to Mary who has a general shop and they have two children.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy spare parts for sale in his business.

Edward hopes to invest more in his business and make more income and be able to open more spare part shops in other towns.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Fadel is a blacksmith. He established his business in 2001 and now he has one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2000 as a loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is an engineering student majoring in Civil Engineering; he is 20 years old and a single guy, the oldest among his five siblings.

Wanting to be a good role model to his siblings, he decided to start supporting himself so he applied for this loan to pay for his registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 32 años, su pareja es Elvis, con quien tiene dos hijos: Pamela de 12 y Geyson de 10 años. Ellos habitan en su casa propia, la que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo en una zona agrícola.
Su principal actividad es la agricultura, siembra arvejas y papas, afirma que le conviene sembrar arvejas porque sus precios son altos y las cosecha son 2 ó 3 veces al año. “Normalmente siembro tres bolsas de semillas, de una bolsa cosecho 30 sacos.”, menciona. Por su  parte, Elvis trabaja en una mina, aportando otros ingresos para su familia, pero cuando cesan sus labores en esa empresa, dedica su tiempo a cultivar la tierra. Flora está contenta con sus labores en el campo, porque le agrada su labor, a pesar de ser muy cansado y riesgoso. La ventaja que tiene es que sus productos son vendidos al por mayor inmediatamente, por eso no duda en continuar con su actividad. Una de sus metas es adquirir otros terrenos para ampliar sus cosechas y para sembrar flores (gladiolos), cuya demanda es alta.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”.
Flora invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de arvejas y gladiolos, además de bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Flora is 32-years-old and her spouse is Elvis; they have two children, Pamela, 12 and Geyson, 10.  They live in their own house that they built with much effort in an agricultural zone.

Her main activity is agriculture; she grows peas and potatoes.  She states that it’s advantageous to plant peas because their price is high and they are harvested two or three times a year.  She mentions that she usually plants three sacks of seeds and each bag yields thirty sacks of peas.  Elvis works in a mine contributing additional family income but when his work for the mine is done he also works farming the land.  Flora is happy with her work in the fields because she enjoys her work despite how exhausting and risky it can be.  Her advantage is that her products are sold at wholesale immediately which is why she does not hesitate to continue with her work.  One of her goals is to acquire more land to expand her crops and to plant flowers (gladioli) which are in high demand.

This is her 8th MFP loan and she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She belongs to the “Los Picaflroes de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank.  Flora will use the money from this loan to buy pea and gladiola seeds as well as sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pea and gladiola seeds and also sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nérida tiene 35 años, está casada con Manuel, con quien tiene dos hijos: Karelyn de 16 y Arnol de 9 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia en una localidad agrícola.
Hace 15 años que se dedica a la agricultura; “siembro arvejas, papas y gladiolos (flores)”, comenta, añadiendo que es más rentable la venta de los gladiolos, ya que cada paquete lo vende a 70 soles. Para la venta, le conviene llevar sus productos hacia el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Nérida no descuida sus sembríos y cada vez siembra un poco más, de esta manera piensa adquirir otras parcelas en otros distritos para producir hortalizas. Ahora se esmerará en la siembra de arvejas y en el cuidado de sus sembríos de gladiolos, los que piensa cosechar en noviembre.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “los Picaflores de Patay”. Agradece mucho tantos años de confianza hacia su persona y el apoyo con las charlas educativas.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar semillas de arvejas (con 1000 soles). Lo restante será para adquirir fertilizantes para sus flores y las arvejas que recién sembrará.
texts.en:
Nérida, age 35, is married to Manuel, and they have two children.  Karelyn is 16, and Arol is 9.  This family lives in their own house in an agricultural area.

She has been farming for 15 years.  “I plant peas, potatoes, and gladiolas (flowers),” she says.  She adds that selling the gladiolas is more profitable. Each package sells for 70 soles.  To make her sales she needs to take her products to the wholesale market in the city.

Nérida does not neglect her crops.  Each time she plants a little more.  This way she plans to acquire other parcels of land in other districts in order to produce vegetables.  She will now work hard planting the peas and caring for her gladiola crops, which she is planning on harvesting in November.

This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She belongs to the “Los Picaflores de Patay” [The Patay Hummingbirds] communal bank.  She is grateful for the many years of trust given to her and the support of the educational talks.

With the money she is now requesting she will be able to buy pea seeds (with 1,000 soles).  The rest will be to get fertilizers for her flowers and the recently planted peas.

loans.use: to buy peas seeds and fertilizers for her flowers and peas.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 20 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanos.
Desde los 16 años quiso tener su propio negocio, pero recién hace casi 2 años logró concretar su sueño. Proviene de una familia de artesanos, por eso se esforzó mucho estudiando en el  instituto de bellas artes de su localidad, donde aprendió a pintar hermosos cuadros que vende a los turistas que llagan hasta su localidad. También realiza el bordado de disfraces, faldas y manteles, según afirma le va muy bien y cada día tienen más pedidos. Ahora ella quiere trabajar muy duro para expandir su negocio y ahorrar para adquirir más mercaderías y vender en otras ciudades. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde está segura logrará concretar sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.      
Rocío invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de varios metros de tela de diferentes calidades y colores. También comprará lana de material sintético y de animales, como alpaca y oveja.
texts.en:
Rocío is 20 years old and lives with her mother and her siblings.

Rocío has wanted to have her own business since she was 16, but has only been able to make her dream a reality in the last nearly two years. She comes from a family of artisans, so she put great effort into studying in the institute of fine arts in her community. There, she learned to paint beautiful canvases, which she sells to tourists who visit her town. She also does embroidery of costumes, skirts, and tablecloths; she says that it's going very well and she has more orders every day. Now, she wants to work very hard to expand her business and save so she can acquire more merchandise and sell in other cities.

Rocío belongs to the "Telarmachay" communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP, where she is sure she will reach her goals. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments.

Rocío will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of several meters of fabric of different qualities and colors.She will also buy wool, both synthetic and natural (from animals like alpaca and sheep).

loans.use: to buy several meters of fabric of different qualities and colors. She will also buy wool, both synthetic and natural (from animals like alpaca and sheep).

loans.name: Eulalia Josefina

texts.es:
EULALIA TIENE 66 AÑOS ES SOLTERA NO TIENE HIJOS VIVE EN SAN JOSE DE CHIMBO.

ELLA ES JUBILADA EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE BIENES COMO ALIMENTACION Y OLLAS QUE LE HACEN FALTA EN LA CASA. EL DIENRO LE AYUDADO A REALIZAR LAS COMPRAS DE LOS ALIMENTOS EN EFECTIVO.

EL SUEÑO ES TENER LO NECESARIO PARA PODER VIVIER CONO LOS ALIMENTOS QUE SON IMPORTANTES.

ELLA EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A PASEAR CON UNA HERMANA Y CON LOS SOBRINOS.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 66, is single and has no children.  She lives in San José de Chimbo.

She's retired and is requesting the loan money to buy goods such as food and pots that she needs at home.  The money helped her make the food purchases in cash.

Her dream is to have what's necessary to be able to live, such as the food, which is important.

In her free time she likes to go out with a sister and her nieces and nephews.

loans.use: to buy food and pots

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 59 years old and married with twelve children. He is a fuel (firewood) supplier and has been in operation for the last seven years earning KES 10,000 monthly.

He has applied for his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. He successfully repaid his first loan. He will use the loan to purchase wood for resale.

He plans to plough back the anticipated profits into his business. His hope is that he can provide his children with quality education

loans.use: To purchase fuel (firewood) for resale.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
Karar is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 22 years old, single, and lives with a family of four members, one of whom is employed. 

Karar owns a shop for repairing generators. He established his business in 2010 and now he has one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $1200 as a youth loan to install a roof for the shop and roll shutters. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a roof for the shop and roll shutters

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 29 years old and has a spare parts shop in Naivasha town. He is married to Nancy and they have a three-year-old child.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more spare parts to sell in his shop.

In the future, Paul hopes to grow his business by opening other spare parts shops in other towns.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to stock.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Mary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 5 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her market stall, where she sells cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bananas and a wider variety of vegetables to sell, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and help cover her family's basic needs. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home on it. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and a wider variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 22 years old, married, and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Haidar owns a small restaurant. He established his business in 2006 after a long experience in this field. He has now four employees and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 as a youth loan to renovate the shop and install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client at 26 years old, who is single and lives with a family of nine members, three of whom are employed. 
Alaa owns a small cafeteria for fast food. He established his business in 2007 after a good experience in the fast food business. He has two employees and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2400 as youth loan to install rolling shutters and buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install rolling shutters and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sara Pilar

texts.es:
SARA PILAR TIENE 53 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE DOS HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

SARA PILAR  SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA 15 DÍAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS INSUMOS.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS, LANCHA EN LOS CULTIVOS. EL SUEÑO ES TENER MÁS INGRESOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASEAR.
texts.en:
Sara Pilar is 53 years old and a single mother of two children.  She lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, de Los Rios Province. 

Sara Pilar is a member of the communal back "30 de Julio" (30th of July), which is located in the Zapotal precinct, a part of Ventanas Canton.  The members make their livings in agriculture. 

Sara Pilar makes her living in agriculture.  She plants, rice, beans and corn.  She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies: fertilizers, urea, compost and liquid Mata Monte (an herbicide). 

Sara Pilar purchases her supplies and sells her products in Ventanas every two weeks.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase more supplies. 

She faces challenges, like pests and fungus, in her crops.  Sara Pilar's dream is to have a greater income.  In her free time, she likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, urea, compost and liquid Mata Monte (an herbicide).

loans.name: Isidro 	Jr.

texts.en:
Isidro is a 34-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of six young children ages 16, 14, 12, 9, 7 and three years old. Isidro has been in the fishing business for more than fourteen years now. This is the source of his daily income which he uses for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

Isidro is asking for a loan worth 13,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets, fuel and for the maintenance of the fishing boat. With this loan, Isidro will be able to increase his daily catch thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

In the future, Isidro wants to improve his business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs and expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fuel and for the maintenance of the fishing boat

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last five years with very good income.

This is his sixth loan with Kadet Ltd. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to purchase a cow.

He hopes to diversify and become a dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 27 years old and sells foodstuffs. He is requesting a loan so he can buy more rice and fish for resale.

If he is able to accumulate profits from his business, he plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Julia Emperatriz

texts.es:
JULIA TIENE 76 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA TIENE 3 HIJOS DE 35, 40, 50 ELLOS SON CASADOSA LA SEÑORA VIVE CON EL ESPOSO.

SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN UN LOCAL ADECUADO EN SU CASA. EL DIENRO DEL CREDITO NECESITA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE CEBOLLA, PAPAS, ACEITE, PAPAS DE RES Y DE CERDO, COLAS Y JUGOS. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INCREMETAR LAS VENTAS Y TENER UN POCO MAS DE GANANCIAS.

EL SUEÑO DE JULIA ES AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS. EN LOS MONTOS LIBRES LE GUSTA DESCANSAR.
texts.en:
Julia, 76, is married and has three children, ages 35, 40, and 50, who are all married.  She lives with her husband.

She works selling food in a place set up in her house.  She needs the loan money to invest in buying onions, potatoes, oil, fried potatoes, and soda and juice.  The loan money helped her increase her sales and have a little more profit.

Julia's dream is to increase her sales.  In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 48 años, está casada con Moisés, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: Shirley y Mayra.
Su negocio es la crianza de cuyes desde hace 3 años. “Fue una buena idea incursionar en la crianza de cuyes al por mayor y menor, aunque el comienzo me resultó algo difícil”, menciona. Ella sabe que con esfuerzo y voluntad todo resulta, ha comenzado a mejorar su granja con cuyes de mejor raza para poder venderlos a un mayor precio. También se dedica al tejido, sus principales prendas son gorras de todo tamaño y color. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP. Promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Hilda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cuyes hembras, para continuar con la crianza de estos animalitos. También comprará lana de diferentes colores.
texts.en:
Hilda is 48 years old. She is married to Moisés, with whom she has five children. Now, only two of their children, Shirley and Mayra, live with them.

Her business for the last three years has been raising guinea pigs. "It was a good idea to get into raising guinea pigs for wholesale and retail, although getting started was pretty hard for me," she says. She knows that everything happens through effort and will, and has started to improve her farm with better quality guinea pigs to be able to sell them at a higher price. She also works at knitting; her main garments are hats of all sizes and colors.

Hilda belongs to the "Telarmachay" communal bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Hilda will invest the requested money in the purchase of female guinea pigs, so she can continue breeding these little animals. She will also buy wool af different colors.

loans.use: to buy female guinea pigs, so she can continue breeding these little animals. She will also buy wool of different colors.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 12,720 pesos Socorro podrá comprar zapatos y ropa de segunda mano y cosméticos para su tienda de ropa y artículos de cuidado personal.
