Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará injertos de cacao para cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 48, has been a widow for ten years.  She has three children living with her in her own house that she purchased with help from her late husband.

She works tilling the soil; she has a parcel of land planted with cocoa beans, coca leaf and coffee.  She’s been working at this for 22 years and knows that her most profitable plants are the cocoa beans and the coca leaf because the gathering centers pay better prices for them.  One of her problems is combating insects that damage the fruit above all during the rainy season.  For the future, she hopes to gather more funds to buy new land and increase her crops but for now she’ll be grafting the cocoa beans.

This is her 16th MFP loan and she recognizes that she has the obligation to make all her payments punctually and is determined to do so.  She’s aware of all the agreements made by her communal bank because she’s a very participative member.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy cocoa bean plant grafts to grow on her land.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plant grafts.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a 55-year-old resident of Barangay III, Tangub City in the Philippines. Alicia provides for her family with her modest monthly earnings of 10,000 PHP. Alicia has operated her own piggery business for 38 years to supplement her husband's income. However in 2011 she became a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a microfinance loan from GDMPC. She hopes to borrow 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies for her pigs. One day, Alicia hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries such rice, frozen foods, snack foods and others.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 20 years and also earns an income from e-loading (a cell phone service widely used in the Philippines).

Analyn aspires to save enough money to build her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy groceries such rice, frozen foods, and snack foods.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married and has 2 children. She is 57 years old and resides in Bagumbang, Bonifacio. Evelyn owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Evelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es un hombre muy responsable, tiene 37 años, y gracias a su trabajo llegó a comprar su casa propia, la cual está hecha de material rustico; allí habita solo, ya que es soltero. 
Su trabajo es labrar la tierra, tiene plantas de cacao, café y hoja de coca. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad solo, pero para el deshierbo de malezas y las cosechas cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros. Lo que más le gusta es cultivar cacao, ya que es el fruto que le da más ingresos y la cosecha es mensual. Por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad, ya que el tiempo de recorrido es de una hora a caminata. Para el futuro, espera comprar su propia moto carguero para el transporte de sus productos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con sus proyectos. También agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar junto a ellos.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles, más su dinero ahorrado,  comprará un terreno agrícola para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Marcial is 37 years old. He is a very responsible man, and thanks to his work he has managed to buy his own house, which is made of simple materials. He lives there alone, as he is single. 

His work is farming. He has cacao, coffee and coca leaf plants. He has been doing this work on his own for 15 years, but has the help of laborers for weeding and harvesting.

What he likes best is growing cacao, as it is the crop that gives him most income and is harvested monthly.

On the other hand, he considers that the most difficult part is transporting his products from the field to the community, as the trip involves an hour's walk. In the future, he hopes to buy his own cargo motorcycle for transporting his crops. 

This is his second loan with MFP, and he is very pleased to know that he will have financial help, as this way he will feel confident of moving forward with his projects. He is also grateful to the members of his communal bank for allowing him to work with them.

With these 1,000 nuevos soles, along with the money he has saved, he will buy a piece of farmland in order to increase his output.

loans.use: To buy farmland in order to increase his output.

loans.name: Alex David

texts.es:
Alex tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y su menor hijo. La casa está ubicada en la Caserío Charan Coposo en el Distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.. Álex vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla Álex, es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 4 años de experiencia en la ganadería. Complementariamente es trabajador estable en un fundo agrícola, en donde le pagan quincenalmente.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.
Álex desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales y obtener una mejor producción que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alex, 22, has a spouse and a son in his care.  He lives with his spouse and minor son in his own house located in Caserío Charan Coposo in Tambogrande District, a district dedicated primarily to growing fruit that’s processed for export to other countries.  It belongs to Piura Province in Piura Region located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Alex lives in the rural part of the district but does have electricity.

Alex works raising small farm animals (sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl) that when they reach ideal size and weight are sold in the local market.  He has more than four years’ experience raising animals.  He’s also a regular employee at a large agricultural firm where he’s paid every two weeks.  He’s able to cover his and his family’s expenses with his income.

Alex wants to buy feed to improve his animals’ care and obtain better production so that he can continue forward with his business which is why he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help him reach his objective.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Clea

texts.en:
Clea is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the food vending business for more than ten years now. Aside from that, she also raises livestock such as chickens, goats and others. 

Clea lacks additional funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetables, seasonings and others. With this, she will be able to cook more for her customers and buyers. 

Clea dreams of expanding her business in the future to augment her income. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetables, seasonings and others.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde is married with five children. Melinde is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Melinde is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

Melinde has been a member of PMPC for  more than one year. In the future, Melinde hopes to expand her farmland and hopefully make it more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is fifty years old and lives in Kalasan, Pagadian city. She is married with five children.  
              
To earn a living, Julita has a business selling bread. She earns about ten thousand pesos each month doing this type of work. Julita has requested a loan of fifty thousand pesos to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery. 

Julita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Julita would like to open other branch.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: Marhamat is 39 years old. She is a divorcee and has no children. Marhamat lives with her mother in a rented apartment. They have a very difficult life. Her brother went to Russia and works there. Little by little his work is becoming better and now they want to buy their own apartment but they need to have 1000 USD. Marhamat and her family await your support.

loans.use: To buy an apartment for herself and her mother to live in.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is from Poblacion, Bonifacio. She is 58 years old, married and has three children. They have been growing bananas for ten years and earn 6,000 PHP a month. Her children have helped her in taking care of their bananas.

In 2011, Candelaria joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Mauro Antonio

texts.es:
Mauro tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene  4 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, con esposa e hijos.  Su comunidad está ubicada a 30 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande perteneciente a Las Lomas.  Sólo cuenta con algunos servicios básicos como luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Mauro junto con su esposa, es la venta de chicha, cerveza, piqueos, en su propio domicilio, donde atiende los días viernes, sábados y domingos para lo cual ya tiene clientela establecida de la zona y caseríos aledaños. Además trabaja en parcelas aledañas como jornalero. Su conviviente lo apoya en todas sus actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio. 
Mauro anhela hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que solicita crédito de S/. 1,500 en Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus piqueos, comidas, compra de  cajas de cervezas, compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha de jora. Mauro tiene grandes deseos de superación y anhela fervientemente el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Mauro is 43 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in his own home, togethre with his spouse and children. His town is located 30 minutes from the district capital of Tambo Grande, near Las Lomas. He lives with only basic utilities such as electric light. Alongside his wife, Mauro operates a business selling chica, beer, and snacks from his own home where he serves guests on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. He has an established clientele from the area and from neighboring villages. Additionally, he works as a laborer on neighboring farmlands. His wife asists in all the business he does, and they have a good working relationship that will help the business grow. Mauro wishes to see his business grow, and for this reason he is applying for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa to purchase supplies for the preparation of his snacks, meals, and chicha, and also to purchase cases of beer. Mauro has a great desire to succeed and earnestly wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the preparation of snacks, meals, and chicha, and to purchase cases of beer for resale.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 03 hijos. La casa está ubicada en la Caserío Jesús del Valle en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Javier vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla Javier es la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con más de 5.0 has de terreno agrícola, de las cuales 1.0 has es de mango, 2.0 has de limón y 2.0 has de banano; todo se encuentra en producción y bien conducido por el cliente, quién es un agricultor con más de 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad cubre sus gastos y los de su familia. 
Javier desea mejorar su producción, es por ello que necesita comprar fertilizantes.  Él en su anhelo de crecer, está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por S/. 3,000, lo cual lo destinará para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de mango y banano.
Javier es conocido en la zona por ser una persona emprendedora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Javier is 57 years old, is married and has 3 children in his care. He lives in his own house with his wife and 3 children. The house is located in the Caserío Jesús Valeey in the district of Tambogrande. Javier lives in the rural part of the district, but has electricity services.
Javier is in agriculture for a living, for which he has more than 5 hectares of farmland. This is composed of 1 hectar of mango, 2 of lemon, and 2 of banana. Everything is in production and well driven by the customer, who is a farmer with more than 15 year of experience in agriculture. With the income that he receives from this work, he covers his expenses and those of his family.
Javier wants to improve his production. This is why he needs to purchase fertilizer. In his desire to grow, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 soles, which he will use to purchase fertilizers to cultivate mango and banana.
Javier is known in his area for being an entrepreneurial and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero, con  01 hijo como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia hace más de 30 años. Reside en el Caserío Pedregal Alto – Valle De Los Incas del Distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y aún no cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla Jorge es la agricultura, teniendo actualmente 1.5 ha de terreno agrícola en el cual tiene instalado plantaciones de mango y limón en producción que cosecha y vende semanalmente, esta actividad la desarrolla hace más de 15 años y además como actividad complementaria se dedica a criar ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales también comercializa en mercado local. Cuenta con el apoyo de padres en las actividades que realiza.
Jorge se encuentra emocionado y bastante contento con la actividad que está realizando, el desea asegurarse una buena producción y ha decidido aplicar fertilizantes y pesticidas a su cultivo para que el mango y el limón se desarrollen correctamente, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Jorge es un joven responsable y emprendedor. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para adquirir su propio terreno, las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Jorge, 36, is single and has a son in his care.  He has lived in his own house for more than 30 years located in Caserío Pedregal Alto, Valle de los Incas in Tambogrande District, an agricultural zone with regular commercial activity located in Piura Province more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.  He lives in the rural part of this district and still does not have basic utilities.

Jorge’s activity is agriculture.  He currently has a 1.5 hectare parcel of farmland planted with mango and lemons that he harvests and sells weekly.  He’s been doing this for more than 15 years but also raises sheep and barnyard fowl that he sells in the local market too.  His parents help him with the work he does.

Jorge’s excited and quite happy about the work he does.  He wants to insure a good crop yield so has decided to apply fertilizers and pesticides to his crops so that the mangoes and lemons will develop properly.  Since he does not have sufficient capital to do so, he’s had to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alernativa for the first time.

Jorge is a responsible, enterprising young man.  His greatest wish is to continue working in order to acquire his own land.  People who know him consider him to be calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural de este distrito, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Y cuenta con servicios básicos como luz eléctrica.  
La actividad que desarrolla María, es la venta de comida por pedidos, pollo frito, tamales, hamburguesas como actividad principal, esta actividad la desarrolla hace 05 años, en su propio domicilio y también la realiza por pedidos. Su conviviente se dedica a labores como peón agrícola en parcelas aledañas. Los ingresos de ambos alcanza para cubrir los gastos de la familia.
La creciente demanda por su negocio, ha hecho que piense en ampliarlo, por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para la preparación de más comida y comprar utensilios para que desarrolle su trabajo.
texts.en:
María, 54, is married and has two dependent children.  She lives in her own house located in Tambogrande District.  She lives in the rural part of this district, a district dedicated primarily to growing fruit that’s processed for export to other countries.  It belongs to the Piura Province in Piura Region located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  She has basic utilities like electricity.

María’s activity is selling food to order: fried chicken, tamales and hamburgers mostly.  She’s been doing this for five years at home and also to order.  Her spouse works as an agricultural field hand in neighboring fields.  Income from both of them is sufficient to meet family expenses.

Growing demand in her business has led to her considering expanding it which is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy ingredients to prepare more food and to buy utensils to do her work with.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the Philippines. Racquel is a farmer, raising bananas, which she has been doing for seven years.  She earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

Racquel is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Racquel hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children, ages 5 and 2 years old. They live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines and have been in the food vending business for more than a year now. 

Paula works hard in order to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock or supplies for her food vending business such as instant noodles, bread, coffee, and the like. With this, she will be able to enhance her stock to sell to the people in the market.

Paula hopes to make her business a success and saves for future schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock or supplies for her food vending business such as instant noodles, bread, coffee, and the like.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 53 años, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos. Su casa es propia, está hecha de material rustico, y la compró gracias a su esfuerzo en su trabajo.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a veces recolecta botellas descartables para venderlas a los recicladores. Paulina tiene su parcela con cultivos de palillo, plantas de cacao, hoja de coca y barbasco. Viene trabajando 27 años y lo que más le gusta es cosechar, pues así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan una recompensa. Por otro lado, lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su chacra hasta su localidad, donde le ofrecen los mejores precios por sus granos y hojas de coca. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y  sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes e insecticidas para mejorar sus plantaciones y así obtener buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Paulina, 53, is a widow with four children. She bought her house, which is made of basic materials, with money she earned. She is a farmer and sometimes collects discarded bottles to sell to recyclers. Paulina has a plot on which she grows string beans, cacao, and coca and mullein leaves. She has been working for 27 years, and what she likes best is harvesting because this makes her feel that she is being rewarded after months of hard work. The most difficult part is transporting the products from her farm to the local market, where the best prices are offered for her grains and coca leaves. She would like to buy more land to plant in the future.

This is her 11th loan cycle with MFP. She knows that if she pays promptly, she will easily be able to get another loan and won't create problems for her communal bank. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve her crops and yield a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops.

loans.name: Silvia Ines

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 59 años de edad, es conviviente y con 01  hijos como carga familiar, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la agricultura y ganadería, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el manejo de sus negocios, cultivo de limón y crianza de ovinos, cerdos y aves de corral, ambos los asiste con tecnología media, su conviviente lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio.  Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para cubrir los gastos familiares.

Silvia está solicitando un crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual lo utilizará del crédito será la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio en el mercado local esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia is 59 years old. She lives with her partner and has one dependent child.  She lives in her own home, located in Tambogrande district in Piura region,  four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

The client lives in the rural part of this district and only has basic electricity service. 

The work she does is farming and livestock-raising. She has more than 15 years experience managing her businesses: growing lemons and raising sheep, pigs and poultry. She looks after both using medium technology. 

Her partner helps her in the work she does, as there is a strong family relationship that enables her to keep her business growing. She uses the income she earns to cover the household expenses. 

Silvia is applying for a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will use to purchase balanced feed for fattening livestock. This way she will be able to sell them at a better price in the local market.

This investment will allow her to keep her business growing and so improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for livestock.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 41 años, está casada con Yover, de 44 años, con quien tiene tres hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, de material  rustico, la que compraron hace 12 años.
Ella y su esposo trabajan todos los días en sus campos de cultivo. Con mucho esfuerzo han logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, donde tienen cacao, café y hoja de coca, ya que estos son los productos que mejor precio tiene en los mercados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta los centros de acopio, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa a base de material noble (ladrillo y cemento), por ello se esmera en seguir trabajando con muchas ganas.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera cumplir su propósito y por ello está dispuesta a devolver todo, con sus aportes puntuales, como en sus anteriores créditos.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará fertilizantes para sus plantas, también contratará a peones para que le apoyen en la labor.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 41, is married to Yover, 44, and they have three children.  The house they live in is theirs; it’s made from rustic materials and they bought it 12 years ago.

She and her husband work every day in their fields and with much effort have managed to make their land productive.  They grow cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf since these are the products that have the best market prices.  What she enjoys best about her work is protecting her plants from possible infestations that can affect them which would greatly reduce her profits.  She’s been doing this work for 18 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport the products to the gathering centers which is where she sells them.  Her greatest wish is to build her house with substantial materials (bricks and cement) and this is why she continues to work so hard.

This is her 4th MFP loan and she expects to reach her goal.  She’s determined to totally repay it making her monthly installments punctually like she did with previous loans.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy fertilizer for her plants and to hire day laborers to help her with the work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 29 años, gracias a su labor pudo comprar su casa, en la que ahora habita con su esposa Olga y su hijo Nelson de 6 añitos.
Su trabajo es labrar la tierra, lo hace desde hace 10 años, donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café. Nelson sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos, los cuales comercializa en su misma localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan la recompensa, pero por otro lado, lo más difícil es cargar los pesados sacos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contento.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono y fertilizantes para el buen crecimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Nelson, 29, was able to purchase his own house thanks to his efforts; he lives there now with his wife, Olga, and his son, Nelson, 6.

He has worked in agriculture for the last ten years; he grows cocoa beans and coffee.  Nelson is quite aware that the money he earns is from producing good quality fruit that’s sold locally.  What he likes best about his work is harvesting because that’s when he sees the reward for long months of hard work.  On the other hand, however, what’s most difficult is carrying the heavy sacks from his field to his community.

This is his third MFP loan and he promises to be very punctual with his payments because he does not want to cause any problems for his communal bank where he feels very happy.  He will use these 1000 new soles to buy manure and fertilizer for his plants’ good growth.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa, gracias a ello pudo obtener su casa propia, en la que ahora habita con sus tres hijos, y a quienes les brinda amor de padre y madre.
Juana es campesina, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niña. Viene trabajando en su propia chacra desde hace 16 años, tiene cultivos de cacao, café y hoja de coca. Ella sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir frutos de buena calidad, los cuales comercializa dentro de su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como una recompensa. Por otro lado, lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la chacra hasta el punto de secado, debido al peso de los sacos. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida que ella.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP, sabe que este dinero le ayudará en el progreso de su actividad. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes para sus plantas.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old and is a very driven woman. Thanks to her hard work she was able to acquire her own home, where she currently lives with her three children, whom she loves as their mother and father.

Juana is a peasant. Her parents taught her the trade when she was a very young child. She has been farming her own land for sixteen years. She grows cocoa beans, coffee, and coca leaf. She knows very well that the money she obtains is for producing good-quality products, which she sells locally. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting, because it makes her feel like she is being rewarded for the months of hard work. On the other hand, the hardest part is transporting the products from her farmland to where they are placed to dry, because the sacks are heavy. Her greatest desire is for her children to become decent adults and have a better quality of life than her.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. She knows this money will help her business advance. She is very well-loved by her fellow members at the communal bank because she is very supportive.

She will use these 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer for her plants.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her plants.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has four children and lives in the Murang'a area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. She is a dairy farmer, which she has been doing for 15 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

Beatrice is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a chuff cutter to ease feeding of her dairy animals. Her biggest challenge is using a panga (machete) when cutting the nappier grass. Her highest monthly expense is business related. This loan will reduce her workload, thereby giving Beatrice more time to do other jobs

Beatrice chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they support smallholder farmers and come to the farmers in the field.  During a microfinance training sessions, she learned that loans must be paid and guaranteed by group members.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Jesús del Valle en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito.
La actividad que desarrolla Raúl es la agricultura contando con 1 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor ovino y aves de corral, cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, existe una buena relación familiar.
 Raúl ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1,000.  El destino del crédito será la compra de fertilizantes para cultivo de limón y realizar labores de poda y deshierbo del cultivo, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raúl, 37, has a live-in partner and 5 children. He lives in his own home in the village of Jesús del Valle, located in the rural area of Tambogrande district. Raúl is a farmer and has a 1 hectare plot where he grows lemons that he picks weekly. He also raises lambs and poultry. He has 6 years of experience in this business and maintains a good relationship with his family.

Raúl has requested a loan of S/. 1,000 from Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to prune and weed his lemon trees. This investment will let him keep growing his business and improving the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Carmen Herminia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos dependientes. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte urbana de este distrito, y cuenta con servicios básicos como luz eléctrica y agua.
La actividad que desarrolla Carmen es la venta de artículos de piñateria, accesorios y pasamanería, hace más de 3 años, negocio lo tiene acondicionado en casa de padres, los cuales la apoyan en tosa actividad que realiza. Cuenta con clientela establecida y ya es conocida en la zona. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayuda para cubrir sus gastos y apoyar en la canasta familiar.
Carmen ha solicitado un crédito de S/. 2,000 a Edpyme Alternativa.  Con el préstamo comprará un lote de mercadería para ofrecer una variedad de opciones al público. Cuenta con clientela establecida, siendo muy conocida en la zona, esto le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old, single, and has no dependent children. She lives in her parents' home, which is located in the district of Tambogrande. She lives in the urban area of the district, which has basic services like electricity and water.

Carmen has been selling party supplies, piñatas, and decorations for over three years. Her business is set up in her parents' house and they support her in all her endeavors. She has a well-established customer base and she is well-known in the area. The income she makes from her business allows her to cover her expenses and contruibute to the household income.

Carmen has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will use this loan to purchase a batch of merchandise to offer the public a variety of options. This will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and offer decorations and supplies for kids' events.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y a la ganadería, cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar vive la señora Ruth, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos ya todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos  aun vive con ella y estudia medicina en la universidad. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, tanto de primera necesidad como también artículos de bazar, papelería, bebidas y helados, allí  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando tienen tiempo pero por lo general ella siempre está atendiendo su tienda ya que allí se entretiene, los productos los recibe en su local. Tiene siete años con su negocio y le va bastante bien.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que siempre los créditos que recibe son de mucha ayuda, el crédito anterior lo utilizó para comprar productos que no tenía en su tienda lo cual le sirvió para aumentar su clientela ya que al tener más variedad de productos llegaron más clientes a su negocio, ahora espera recibir este crédito y lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y productos de papelería y bazar. Lleva en el banco comunal siete ciclos y le gustan los créditos que ofrecen la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the “San Ignacio de Colon” communal bank meet every two weeks in San Ignacio in Colon Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who are dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Ruth, 55, lives here.  She’s married and has seven children, all adults now.  The youngest of them still lives with her and is studying medicine at university.  Her husband’s a driver.

She has a home-based store where she sells all types of products:  basic staples and general merchandise, stationery supplies, beverages and frozen treats.  She works there every day from 6am until 9pm and sometime even later.  Her son and husband help her when they have time but in general it’s she who tends to the store since she keeps herself busy that way.  She receives her goods at the store and she’s been in business seven years and does quite well.

She is repeating the loan since the loans she gets are always of much help to her.  She used the previous one to buy products she did not have in her store which helped her increase her clientele because having more variety of products in stock led to more customers coming.  Now, she expects to get this new loan and will use it to stock the store even more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods, stationery supplies and household items.  

She’s been in the communal bank seven cycles and likes it because of the loans the institution provides.  Her goal is to continue forward with her business and that it grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья торгует кожгалантереей и сумками в Бердянске. Она владеет двумя торговыми точками, на одной из которых торгует реализатор. Наталья - предприимчивая, оптимистичная, добрая, постоянно вовремя выплачивает зарплату своему работнику, постоянно торгует  и обновляет свой товар. Более того, она - хорошая хозяйка, любящая жена: у нее крепкая и дружная семья. Кредит от КИВА Наталья надеется вложить в закупку сумок, кошельков, барсеток, кожаных поясов. Она надеется при помощи дополнительных средств съездить за товаром, тем самым увеличив его ассортимент, товарооборот и прибыль.
texts.en: Natalya sells leather accessories and bags in Berdyansk. She owns two sales stands and employs a salesperson at one of them. Natalya is enterprising, optimistic and kind. She always pays her salespersons' salary on time. She keeps working herself and renewing her stock. In addition, she is a good homemaker and a loving wife: she has a close-knit family. Natalya hopes to receive a loan from Kiva to stock up on bags, wallets, wristlets and leather belts. Thanks to these additional funds, she hopes to make a trip in order to stock up on merchandise, increasing her selection of goods, sales volume and revenues.

loans.use: to stock up on bags, wallets, wristlets and leather belts.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband works as a fisherman. They have four children. Regina is a fish vendor and has been in this business for several years now.

Regina is requesting a loan worth 10000 PHP to buy new fishing nets, fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish stock to sell in the market.
 
For the future, Regina dreams of making her business a success, so that it will generate more income for the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy new fishing nets, fuel and pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.ru: Анжелика торгует окорочками, полуфабрикатами, мясной продукцией на одном из местных рынков. Она – очень трудолюбивая, об этом говорят и ее покупатели, и коллеги рыночники. Торговая точка расположена удачно для ходовой торговли, а, значит, есть постоянный покупательский спрос на продукцию, которую Анжелика реализует. Кредит нужен Анжелике для закупки партии окорочков, мясных каркасов и прочей мясной продукции.
texts.en: Anzhelika  sells  hams, prepared foods and meat products at one of the local markets. She is very hard-working; both her customers and other vendors at the market say so. Her sales stand is located in an area with a lot of traffic, which means there is constant demand for Anzhelika's goods. Anzhelika needs a loan in order to stock up on hams, meat ribs and other meat products.

loans.use: to stock up on hams, meat ribs and other meat products.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна уже один раз пользовалась кредитом КИВА. Она осталась очень довольна предоставленными финансовыми услугами, которые оказались как нельзя более своевременными для ее бизнеса. За счет полученных дополнительных средств Татьяна смогла увеличить свой доход и помочь семье.
На данный момент она решила снова обратиться к КИВА за кредитом, чтобы докупить товар и расширить свой ассортимент перед осенне-зимним сезоном, когда он будет особенно пользоваться спросом среди покупателей.
texts.en:
Tatyana has already received a loan from Kiva once before. She was very happy with the financial services provided, which could not have been more timely for her business. Due to the additional funds, Tatyana was able to increase her income and help her family. 

Currently, Tatyana has decided to turn to Kiva for a loan again, in order to purchase additional goods and broaden her assortment before the fall and winter season. Then the goods will be especially in demand among the customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and broaden her assortment before the fall and winter season

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 20 años de  edad, soltera,  sin hijos dependientes. Su casa se ubica en el CPME Cruceta en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en casa propia junto con su madre que la apoya en las actividades que realiza. Fabiola es técnica en enfermería.
La actividad que desarrolla Fabiola  es la venta de artículos,  accesorios, utensilios para la casa hace más de 2 años. Clienta compra mercadería en la ciudad de Piura al por mayor.  También vende 
Fabiola necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en capital de trabajo para la compra de un lote de mercadería para negocio entre cubiertos de acero, porcelana, ollas, accesorios de cocina. Por lo que ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por S/. 500.
Fabiola tiene deseos de seguir creciendo en su negocio y con ello mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Anhela elevar su nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 20 years old, single, with no dependent children. Her home is located in Cruceta in Tambogrande district. She lives in her own home with her mother who helps her in the work she does. Fabiola is a nursing technician. 

For more than two years Fabiola has been selling household items, accessories and utensils. 

She buys merchandise in the city of Piura at wholesale, and also sells. 

Fabiola needs a loan so that she can use it as working capital for the purchase of a batch of merchandise for her business, such as metal cutlery, china, pots and kitchen accessories.

Therefore she has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. 

Fabiola wishes to keep her business growing and so improve her family's standard of living.  She wants very much to raise her level of sales.

loans.use: To buy items used in the home, for later sale.

loans.name: El Sol Naciente  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Sol Naciente es un banco comunal que está formado por 9 socias quienes con su trabajo ayudan a mejorar la economía de sus hogares y sacan  adelante a sus familias, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es de clima frió pero el calor de su gente es muy acogedor para todos los que la visitan, esta ciudad es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente aun mantiene viva la llama de su cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Maribel del Pilar, es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una sobrina. Vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 23, 21, 18, 17 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su tercer hijo tiene una discapacidad y pasa en casa, su cuarta hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Maribel del Pilar es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos, se encuentra viviendo en la ciudad desde hace un año y fue invitada a vivir en esta ciudad por su sobrina por las oportunidades de trabajo, por el momento se encuentra armando todo para iniciar su negocio ya que se va a dedicar a la venta de comida.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una carreta que es lo único que le hace falta para comenzar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en este negocio que va a iniciar.
texts.en:
El Sol Naciente (The Rising Sun) is a communal bank made up of 9 members who, with their work, help to improve the economic situation of their households and move their families ahead. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. It has a cold climate, but the warmth of its people is very welcoming to all who visit. This city is a mix of the colonial and the modern. Its people still keep alive the flame of its culture and the traditions of its peoples. Its gastronomy is quite varied, which captivates its visitors' palates.

One of the members of this group is Maribel del Pilar. This is her first loan in the communal bank, to which she was invited by a niece. She lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca. She is 45 and is married, and in her conjugal union she has conceived 5 children aged 11, 17, 18, 21, and 23. Her oldest, a son, is married and lives independently; her second, a son, works and helps her economically; her third, a son, is disabled and lives at home; her fourth, a daughter, attends a secondary school in the city; and her youngest, a daughter, attends a little primary school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Maribel del Pilar is a native of Ríos province. She has been living in the city for a year. She was invited to live in this city by her niece because of the opportunities for work. At the moment she is putting together everything to start her business, since she is going to sell food. 

She is going to use the loan to purchase a cart, which is the only thing she needs to start her business.

Her goal is to grow in this business that she is going to start.

loans.use: to purchase a cart

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería, cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 12 y 5 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor esta en jardín de infantes. El marido es mecánico automotriz.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja tres días de la  semana más que todo por las mañanas que es cuando sus hijos estudian, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra los fines de semana, tiene muchos clientes que le realizan pedidos ya que les da facilidades de pago. Lleva dos años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior le fue de gran ayuda, el mismo que le dejo muy buenas ganancias las cuales utilizo para los gastos que genero el ingreso de sus hijos a los centros de estudio donde ellos acuden, espera este nuevo  crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños y con esto seguir en su negocio que le da muchas satisfacciones. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha ido mejorando su vida.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “San Ignacio de Colon” communal bank meet every two weeks in San Ignacio in Colon Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who are dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Angélica, 29, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 13, 12 and 5 years old.  The older ones attend secondary school and the youngest is in Kindergarten.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own income sells all types of clothes door to door.  She works three days a week especially during the morning when her children are at school.  She sells on credit and collects payment on the weekend.  She has many customers that place orders with her because she gives them easy payment options.  She’s been in business two years and does very well.

 She is repeating the loan since the previous one was very helpful; it yielded good profits that she used to pay expenses generated by her children’s return to school.  She hopes to use this new loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children’s clothes to stay in this business that gives her so much satisfaction.  

This is her 6th loan with the communal bank and she likes it because all the loans have improved her life.  Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 34 years old, married and has one child. She lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City.

She owns a general store, which has been her source of income for almost two years. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.

She has been a very good member of this institution for almost five years. In the future, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman, expanding her business with the help of this organization.

loans.use: purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the Philippines.  Josephine is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Josephine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for her vegetables.  She has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her farm and export her vegetables to different countries.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, se separo hace más de un año de su esposo; tiene dos hijos, uno que aún está en colegio y el otro que estudia Ingeniería en un Instituto especializado en dicha rama;  viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona El Rosario de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente, Gloria trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada  por más de diez horas al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de pensiones de su instituto de su hijo ya que él estudia Ingeniería y con los ingresos de Gloria  no le alcanza para pagar los estudios de sus dos hijos.
El sueño de Gloria es mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos ya que desea que sean profesionales.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Gloria separated from her husband over a year ago.  She has two children; one of them is still in high school and the other is studying engineering in an institute that specializes in this subject.  They live in her own, two-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s El Rosario zone.

Gloria is currently employed at a private firm and works more than ten hours daily since she’s the only one who covers education, food and basic utility costs for her family.

She needs the loan to pay tuition at the institute her son who’s studying engineering attends; Gloria’s income is insufficient to cover educational costs of both her children.

Gloria’s dream is to improve her income so she can cover both children’s educational costs because she wants them to become professionals.  This is her first loan request to Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son who is studying engineering.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 51 años, él  vive y trabaja junto a su esposa e hijo, en la parroquia  Valle Hermoso de la ciudad de Santo Domingo. 
Santo Domingo es la cuarta ciudad del Ecuador más poblada, por eso,  es punto de enlace entre ciudades importantes del país, posee un  clima cálido, está a 655 m. sobre el nivel el mar, a unos 100 kms. del Océano Pacífico. Latitud 0, su temperatura habitual es de unos 18 a 33 °C en verano. En invierno normalmente hace más calor de 23 a 24 grados. La playa más cercana se llama  “Pedernales”; su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país.
José es persona con gran sentido de responsabilidad, por lo creó hace 10 años su propio negocio de venta de víveres  en su hogar  para el sustento diario de su familia. 
José considera una buena opción los préstamos a través del portal Kiva, ya que menciona obtener un  crédito de un Banco o institución financiera  es muy difícil, porque solicitan muchos documentos y garantías.
El crédito que solicita José, lo piensa invertir en arreglos  de su vivienda y para  ampliar su negocio para atender de mejor manera a sus clientes y para  de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia, ya que  ellos sobreviven de él mismo.
texts.en:
Jose, 51, lives and works with his wife and son in the Valle Hermoso Parish in the city of Santo Domingo.  Santo Domingo is the fourth largest city in Ecuador and, therefore, is one of the most important cities in the country.  It has a warm climate and is 655 meters above sea level, about 100 kilometers from the Pacific Ocean.  At 0 degrees latitude, its average temperature is between 18 and 33 degrees Celcius in summer.  In the winter it usually above 23 or 24 degrees.  The closest beach is called "Pedernales".  Its population is growing rapidly due to its strong commerce and the fact that it is one of the largest livestock markets in the country.

Jose is a person with a great sense of responsibility, having established his own grocery store ten years ago in his house to provide an income for his family.

Jose believes the Kiva loans are a good option because getting a bank or financial institution loan is very difficult due to the many documents and guarantees required.

The loan Jose is requesting is to renovate his house and expand his business so he can better attend to his customers and increase his earnings, thereby offering all of his family a better quality of life since they all depend on him.

loans.use: To renovate his house and business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fish to increase her stock.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 33 years old, married, and has three children. He has been running a restaurant for seven years earning a monthly income of 100,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. 

Patrick is requesting for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy food for his restaurant. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will invest in farming. He hopes to own a resort and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase food for his restaurant, such as sugar, cooking oil, and baking flour.

loans.name: Loida Elizabet

texts.es: Loida Elizabet, ella es originaria de San José Poaquil, con su esposa tiene 6 hijos menores de edad ella se ha dedicado a la venta y elaboración de ropa típica a mano, es una persona que día a día se dedica a su negocio ya que es la única forma conque puede darles una vida mejor a sus hijos, ella vende en el mercado municipal de su localidad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos a mano.
texts.en: Loida Elizabet is from San Jose Poaquil.  She is a housewife with six minor children, and makes and sells typical hand-made clothing.  She is a person who dedicates her time to her business every day so she can give her children a better lifestyle.  She sells her goods at the municipal market in the town, and is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make her hand-woven fabrics.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make typical hand-woven fabrics.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 31,500 pesos Ana ha podido comprar mercancia para renovar el inventario de su tienda. Ana inició este negocio hace dos años, como una manera de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, sin tener que buscar un empleo, pues no quería salir de casa todo el día para poder cuidar a su niño que ahora tiene 3 años.
Ana paga alquiler, por lo que su sueño es poder comprar una casa propia para su familia, así como ahorrar para enviar a su hijo y los otros que quiere tener a la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana was able to use a 31,500 peso loan to buy merchandise to renew her store’s stock inventory.  Ana started this business two years ago as a way to help her husband with household expenses without having to go out looking for a job because she did not want to be out of her house all day so that she could take care of her son who is now three-years-old.  

Ana pays rent so her dream is to buy a house of her own for her family as well as to save up in order to send her son and the other children she wants to have to university.

loans.use: to renew her store's stock inventory.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 15,900 pesos Ramón ha podido reparar y remodelar el local donde opera su barbería. Ramón inició su peluquería desde hace diez años y tiene un buen numero de clientes fieles y frecuentes.
Ramón es casado, tanto su esposa como él están en la universidad. Tienen un niño de nueve años que está en quinto grado de la escuela primaria.
Ramón desea seguir trabajando duro, con esta remodelación planea agregar una nueva silla a la peluquería y buscar un ayudante. El quiere terminar la universidad y continuar siendo un buen proveedor para su casa.
texts.en:
With a loan of 15,900 Pesos, Ramon has been able to repair and remodel his barber shop.  He began his business ten years ago and now has many loyal, frequent customers.

Ramon is married and both he and his wife are enrolled in the university.  They have a nine-year-old son who is in fifth grade at the elementary school.  Ramon wants to continue working hard and, with this remodeling, plans to add a new barber chair and look for an assistant.  He wants to finish his university educaiton and continue being a good provider for his household.

loans.use: To repair an remodel his barber shop.

loans.name: Sofronio Jr.

texts.en:
Sofronio Jr. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. He is 49 years old, married, and has two children.

Sofronio Jr. is a farmer. He owns and operates a coffee farm and also has a piggery as his other source of income. He has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

Sofronio Jr. is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers for his coffee farm and feeds for his piggery. This will be the 24th loan taken out by Sofronio Jr. from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for his piggery and fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 51,750 pesos Wilfredo ha podido saldar un préstamo que tenía a una tasa de interés muy onerosa (excesivamente alta).
Wilfredo ha sido chofer de una ruta de trasporte de su comunidad por diez años, las cuotas mensuales que tenía que pagar del préstamo de su vehículo eran tan altas, que esto, sumado con el mantenimiento mensual al minibus, a penas dejaban el dinero suficiente para poder mantener su casa.
Wildredo es casado, su esposa vende empanadas en la escula pública de la comunidad. Tienen dos hijos de 14 y 7 años que asisten a esta misma escuela.
Wilfredo planea cambiar el vehículo una vez haya terminado de pagar este préstamo. Wilfredo desea terminar el bachiller, para así dar ejemplo a sus hijos y motivarlos a que continuen estudiando.
texts.en:
With a loan of 51,750 pesos, Wilfredo has been able to pay off a loan that had an excessively high interest rate. 

Wilifredo has been a transportation route driver in his community for 10 years. The monthly payments that he had to pay on the loan for his vehicle were so high that, along with monthly maintenance costs for the minibus, he was left with hardly enough money to maintain his home.

Wilifredo is married, his wife sells empanadas at the public school in the community. They have two children, aged 14 and 7, who attend that same school.

Wilifredo plans to change the vehicle once he has finished paying off the loan. Wilifredo wants to finish high school, and in this way set an example for his children to motivate them to continue their studies.

loans.use: to settle the payment on his minibus.

loans.name: Adderly

texts.es:
Adderly tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente con un hijo.   Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en   Caserío Peñarol en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural de este distrito.
La actividad que desarrolla Adderly es la ganadería contando con 10 ovinos y 12 aves de corral (gallinas, pavos), los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, además se dedica a la agricultura contando con 0,50 has de limón en producción que cosecha semanalmente, dicho terreno es herencia de su padre quien lo apoya en sus actividades. Cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia en su negocio.
Adderly desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera y pueda venderlos a un mejor precio, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado.
Adderly es empeñoso y siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Adderly is 24 years old. He lives with his partner and has a son. He lives in his own house located in the settlement of Peñarol in Tambogrande district. He lives in the rural part of this district.

The work Adderly does is livestock-raising. He has 10 sheep and 12 poultry (chickens and turkeys), that he raises and fattens to later sell in the local market. 

He farms also, having .5 hectares of lemon trees in production, that he harvests weekly. He inherited this piece of land from his father, who helps him in his work. He has more than 6 years of experience in his business.

Adderly wishes to improve the feeding of his animals so that they develop properly and so that he can sell them at a better price. For this reason, he has found it necessary to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, for the purchase of balanced feed.

Adderly is hard-working, and always gives the best of himself to help his family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Maria Isidora

texts.es:
María Isidora, una mujer de 55 años,  casada con Ángel de 65, residen en Alausí un cantón de la Provincia de Chimborazo ubicada al pie del cerro Gampala en la región Andina del Ecuador. El estilo único de sus atractivas calles y edificaciones hicieron que ésta ciudad fuera declarada como Patrimonio Nacional y así se convierta en uno de los lugares de mayor atracción turística en el Ecuador. Por esta razón Alausí ha incrementado su comercio, permitiendo a sus habitantes emprender con sus ideas de negocio en las áreas de gastronomía, agricultura, ganadería, comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, etc.
Es así como María Isidora a pesar de los obstáculos que ha tenido para salir adelante como provenir de una familia de escasos recursos, y además no tener preparación académica; su necesidad la lleva a invertir en su idea de negocio en un sector de la ciudad en donde era escasa la presencia de tiendas y además la demanda era bastante notoria. Inicia con una tienda de abastos hace 3 años, en donde se ofrecen productos de primera necesidad. Dedica 12 horas diarias a la atención de este negocio y también realiza actividades agrícolas. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa para obtener un préstamo que le ayudará a realizar algunas adecuaciones y arreglos en el lugar y además poder comprar mercadería para mejorar la oferta hacia sus clientes y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para llevar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Isidora, 55, is married to Angel, 65, and they live in Alausi, a canton of the Chimborazo Province at the foot of the Gampala hills in the Andean region of Ecuador.  The unique style of its attractive streets and buildings are the reason it was declared a National Heritage site, having become one of the biggest tourist attractions for Ecuador.  This is why Alausi has increased its commerce, allowing its inhabitants to establish businesses in the areas of gastronomy, agriculture, livestock farming and sales of essential need items, etc.

This is how Maria Isidora, despite the obstacles she faced having come from a family with scarce resources and her lack of education, led her to the idea of opening a store in her sector of the city where there is not much competition, so the demand was quite well known.  She set up her grocery store three years ago and offers essential need products.  She spends 12 hours a day attending to her business and also carries out agricultural activities.  She  requested a loan through the Fundacion Alternative to upgrade her store and also buy merchandise to give her customers better service and increase her income, which will provide her with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
Nancy, es una mujer de 32 años, soltera  que vive con su madre y sus dos hijos de 5 y 4 años en Chillogallo, un barrio ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito capital del Ecuador y que es el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, por lo que se ha convertido en un lugar altamente comercial con negocios de todo tipo al alcance de todos sus habitantes. En los últimos años el sector privado ha aprovechado este crecimiento para ampliar la inversión y construir centros comerciales, conjuntos residenciales, etc. 
En este sector en crecimiento reside Nancy, quien solo completó la primaria por los problemas económicos que existían en su hogar, sin embargo, gracias al espíritu emprendedor que heredó de su madre estableció su propio negocio de comida rápida hace 5 años al cual le dedica 6 horas diarias de lunes a viernes y casi 12 horas los fines de semana. Para Nancy es muy importante el crédito otorgado por Fundación Alternativa, financiado por KIVA,  ya que le ayudará a adquirir productos que le den un valor agregado a su negocio y le ayuden a incrementar sus ingresos para de esta forma darles a sus hijos la educación que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de tener.
texts.en:
Nancy, 32, is single and lives with her mother and her two children, ages 5 and 4 in Chillogallo, a neighborhood located in the south sector of the city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  It is the most populated neighborhood in the city and has become a highly commercial area with all kinds of businesses available to its inhabitants.  Over the last few years the private sector has taken advantage of this growth to expand its investment in development of shopping centers, residencial complexes, etc.

In this growth center is where Nancy lives.  She only received an elementary education because of the economic difficulties in her family, but thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, which she inherited from her mother, she set up her own fast food business five years ago where she spends six hours a day, Monday through Friday, and 12 hours on weekends.  For Nancy, the loan she received through Fundacion Alternativa, financed by Kiva, helped her acquire the products she needed to add value to her business, which have increased her income so she can give her children the education she was unable to receive.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Yaniris

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 21,000 Yaniris ha podido comprar arroz, aceite, frijoles, azucar y alimentos enlatados para su tienda de comestibles.
Yaniris inició este negocio hace tres años, buscando ayudar a su esposo a sostener el hogar. El es mensajero en la funeraria de la comunidad. 
Tienen 5 hijos de 26, 25, 24, 19 y 4 años. Los 4 mayores trabajan y la pequeña este año inició el preescolar.
El gran sueño de Yaniris es contruir su casa en block, ya que la que tiene actualmente es de madera y muy insegura.
texts.en:
With a loan of 21,000 Yaniris has been able to buy rice, oil, beans, sugar and canned food for her grocery store.
Yaniris started this business three years ago looking to help her husband support their home. He is a messenger in the community's funeral home.
They have five children who are 26, 25, 24, 19 and 4 years old. The oldest four work, and the littlest one started preschool this year.
Yaniris’ big dream is to build her house out of concrete blocks, since the one she currently has is made of wood and very unsafe.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, sugar and canned food for her store.

loans.name: Dúo Flores De Vista Bella Group

texts.es: Dúo Flores de Vista Bella, María Teresa es originaria de la aldea Vista Bella tiene 5 hijos y se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano, desde hace años se ha dedicado a ésta actividad ya que es el medio que tiene para sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos.
texts.en: María Teresa is a member of the Flores de Vista Bella (Flowers of Vista Bella) communal bank and a native of the village of Vista Bella. She has 5 children. She makes traditional textiles by hand. She has been doing this work for years, since it is the way she has to move her family ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to purchase raw material to make the traditional textiles.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make traditional textiles

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: BIDOSSESSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Rebeca (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Martin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Rebeca et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Rebeca n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de quinze ans que Rebeca mène comme activité la vente de crevettes et d'épices dans un marché du Bénin. Rebeca s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Rebeca sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Bidossessi is a group of three people, whose members are friends. The representative of the group, Rebeca (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 29 years old and is married to an engineer named Martin. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and are their dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple has another child in their care. Rebeca and her husband live with their children and together the couple pays for all of the household expenses. Rebeca has never had any formal schooling.

It has been nearly fifteen years since Rebeca began her business selling shrimp and spices at a market in Benin. Rebeca also purchases her supplies at a market in Benin. Along with the other members of the Bidossessi group, Rebeca is requesting a second loan. The loan will aid Rebeca in her quest to satisfy the demands of her customers. This loan will help the group to better meet the needs of their clients and thereby earn a higher income. The group's first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp and spices.

loans.name: Dúo Libano Group

texts.es:
DÚO LIBANO

Este dúo lo forma doña Rosa Irma quien nos cuenta que es soltera y trabaja duro para mantener a su mama ya que es la única que sostiene su hogar, y se dedica a la venta de huevos y los distribuye en Sacsuy y San Raymundo, ella espera invertir en su venta ya que ahora le están pidiendo huevos en otro sector pero que no tiene suficiente capital para invertir ya que mientras más producto tenga ella puede vender un poco más,es por eso que está solicitando este crédito para la compra de huevos para la venta.
texts.en:
DÚO LIBANO is formed by Rosa Irma, who tells us that she is single and works hard to support her mother, since she is the only one that provides for their household. 

She works selling eggs, which she distributes in Sacsuy and San Raymundo. She hopes to invest in her sales now that she is being asked for eggs in other areas, but she does not have enough capital to invest. If she has more product, she can sell a little more, which is why she is requesting this loan to purchase eggs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 21,000 Alexandra ha podido comprar jugos, referescos, embutidos, aceites, granos y enlatados para su tienda de comestibles.
Alexandra tiene un año con su tienda de comestibles. Es un negocio que ella considera rentable y seguro, pues la comida se vende bien. Su mayor desafío es mantener un capital de trabajo para reabastecer la tienda, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes compran a crédito para pagar quincenal o mensualmente.
Alexandra es casada, su esposo está actuamente desempleado; tienen 3 hijos de 12, 7 y 4 años que estudian en la escuela pública.
Alexandra desea ampliar y expandir su negocio. Hace un año inició con una inversión de 25,000 pesos que ya ha duplicado. Aunque tiene casa propia, esta es muy pequeña para el tamaño de su familia, por lo que quiere poder ampliarla en el futuro.
texts.en:
With the loan of 21,000 pesos, Alexandra has been able to buy juices, soft drinks, sausages, oils, grains, and canned goods for her grocery store. 

Alexandra has had her grocery store for one year. It is a business she considers profitable and secure, since food sells well. Her biggest challenge is maintaining working capital to restock the store, since the majority of her customers buy on credit to pay twice a month or monthly. 

Alexandra is married. Her husband is currently unemployed. They have 3 children, aged 4, 7, and 12, who attend public school. 

Alexandra wants to enlarge and expand her business. One year ago she began with an investment of 25,000 pesos, which she has already doubled. Although she has her own house, it is very small for the size of her family, so she wants to enlarge it in the future.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, sausages, oils, grains, and canned goods

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 44 years old, widowed, and blessed with four children. She owns rental houses in Tala town. She has been in this business for the last ten years and gets an income of  KES.14,000 per month.

She has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her third loan of KES.80,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to renovate the houses. She will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Amanecer (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Amecer y se integra de tres señoras, cada una se dedica a su actividad en un pueblo llamado Coapilla en el que celebran la fiesta de la Virgen de Candelaria el dos de febrero.
 
Soraida está casada con el señor Julio César, llevan diez años de casados, no tienen hijos y son muy felices.
 
Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para un club nutricional en donde vende productos naturales. Soraida lleva trabajando dos años cuatro meses en su negocio y comenta que tiene buenos resultados ya que puede comprar más bienes para su hogar. 

Soraida se motivó a iniciar esta actividad para apoyarse con sus ingresos y para no dejar solo a su esposo que trabaja  en el campo.
 
Lo  que desea de su  actividad y el préstamo  es que ella pueda seguir adelante como también agrandar un poco mas su negocio que tanto la ayuda para sostenerse.

Las señoras que integran en el grupo son: Brijida quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de maíz y frijol y la señora Magdalena quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
The group called "Amanecer" (Dawn) is comprised of three women.  Each one has a business activity in the town of Coapilla. The Festival of the Virgin of Candelaria is celebrated there on February 2.
