Soraida is has been married to Julio César for ten years.  They do not have children, and they are very happy.

She requested the loan to buy merchandise for a nutritional club where she sells natural products.  Soraida has been working in her business for two years and four months.  She says that she has good results, and she is able to buy more goods for her home.

Soraida was motivated to start this business activity in order to get income to reply upon and to not leave it only to her husband, who works in the fields.

What she wishes from her business activity and the loan is to be able to get ahead.  She also wants to expand her business, which helps so much to support herself,  a bit more

The other women in the group are are:

• Brigida will invest in buying and selling corn and beans.
• Magdalena will invest in buying ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to buy and sell natural products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
"I'm very excited about this loan. I hope everything will get better, and I'll keep on taking more loans for my business. I'm grateful to you for your support," says Anna, a retailer from Armavir, Armenia. 

Anna sells women's clothing in a booth, which is located in the city market. She started this business in 2008. Autumn is the most busy season for Anna, as she has many clients from villages who make clothing purchases mainly in this season. So Anna would like to add more clothing in her booth so as to offer a larger variety for her clients. 

Anna lives with her husband and in-laws. Anna's 20-year-old son, Karo, has gone abroad to work and support his family. Anna dreams of her son coming back, staying with the family and starting his own family. She thinks the development of her business will help make this dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Dusica

texts.en:
Dusica is a 29-year-old single woman. She is both hardworking and ambitious. She lives with her mother and brother in the eastern part of Kosovo in a Serbian community. One year ago she opened her own business to provide accounting and bookkeeping to others. 

At first, she worked from her home, but eventually she managed to open an office. She does the accounting and bookkeeping for small and medium-size businesses in her area. This is the main income for her family.

Dusica is requesting a loan to buy office equipment, such as a photocopy machine and a computer. This loan will help her to improve her business and make her more efficient in her work. 

She plans in the near future to open another office in the northern part of Kosovo, which is also in a Serbian community. Her long-term goal is to expand her business and be able to save money for her future, including marriage and a family. She is very grateful to Kiva for supporting her in growing and developing her business.

loans.use: To buy office equipment, such as a photocopy machine and a computer.

loans.name: Jose Mariano

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, necesita invertir en la compra de materiales agrícolas para realizar la siembra de maíz y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, él invertirá en la compra de 8 sacos de abono y pagara el alquiler del terreno que es una manzana de tierra.
Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro comprar materiales para invertirlo en la producción de maíz, de los cuales obtuvo una cosecha de la que genero ganancias, sus condiciones han mejorado en la economía del hogar, manteniéndose el grupo familiar con salud bien estable.
texts.en:
José is seeking a new loan.  He needs to invest in farming supplies so that he can plant his corn, and he currently does not have sufficient funds for this.  He will use the loan proceeds to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer and to rent land for farming.

He reports that with his previous loan he was able to buy materials for planting and growing corn.  This led to a profitable harvest.  His household finances have improved, and is family is in good and stable health.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer and to rent land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and supplies

loans.name: Zoila De Jesus

texts.es:
Zoila, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio en la venta de lociones, cosméticos y mercadería para la tienda, por ejemplo arroz, harina, aceite, y otra mercadería necesaria para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, con la intensión de que sus clientes estén satisfechos.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar el negocio, realizando una buena inversión,  con la que también ha mejorado sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Zoila is requesting a new loan in order to strengthen the business of selling lotions, cosmetics, and merchandise for the store.  She will get things like rice, flour, cooking oil, and other merchandise that is needed in order to have it available at the business.  Her intention is to satisfy her customers.

She says that the previous loan allowed her to improve the business by making a good investment.  With the loan her sales and her family income have also increased.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and merchandise for her store like rice, flour, and cooking oil, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is in her early sixties and married. She has seven children, with one of them still attending high school. They all have been living in northern Albania, but in a different region, for the past 12 years. The workload has been almost the same in both regions, yet life has been better in the current one, and they are content.

Marie has been raising livestock for the past eight years, and she has made positive and steady progress. In recent years, she has been able to serve more clients and, of course, generate more income.

Marie is now applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania to repair her animal stable, and she is aware that her loan information will soon be published on Kiva. She is very grateful to lenders in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: To repair her animal stable

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Sada, who is in her mid-30s, is married, with three children, of which two go to school and one is still young. She has been running a beauty salon for two years now. She is doing great. She works from 8am to 9pm daily, and she able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy needed salon equipment and cover household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more salon equipment.  Her dream is to one day be able to be a big businesswoman of salon and salon equipment.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mchicha," which totals 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Dúo Belen Group

texts.es:
DUO BELEN 
El grupo lo forma doña María de Jesús Chamale Suruy, quien nos cuenta que vende refacciones  en las tardes en su casa además vende un poco de ropa típica de forma ambulante tres veces a la semana por las mañanas, en el caserío los sineyes, solicita el crédito porque quiere comprar un poco de leña y algunas verduras y frutas por mayor a la terminal porque comprando allí se la dan a buen precio y puede obtener un poco mas de ganancia.
texts.en: María de Jesús Chamale Suruy, a member of the communal bank DUO BELEN, says that she sells spare parts from her home in the afternoons. She also sells traditional clothing as a street vendor in her village Los Sineyes three mornings a week. She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale wood, vegetables, and fruit because better prices are offered at the terminal, and she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy wood, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Jaimelita

texts.en:
Jaimelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a 'sari-sari' (variety) store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, chips and other miscellaneous items.

Jaimelita has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Jaimelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, chips and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: John Memusi

texts.en:
John is servicing his third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD that he plans to use to purchase more livestock like goats and sheep for fattening and resale.


He intends to use the anticipated profits to add his animals’ numbers and pay school fees for his children. His future dream is to prosper and improve his family’s living standards

loans.use: to purchase more livestock, e.g., goats and sheep, for sale.

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana is a 46 year-old Egyptian woman from one of the vulnerable ethnic minority communities of southern Albania. She is married and has three daughters. Two of them hold a university degree and Liljana wants to send her younger daughter to university as well, when she finishes high school. 
She feels proud for being able to educate and help her children and her family financially, unlike others in her community.

Liljana is a blacksmith and has been in the field for twenty years. Her husband, also in the picture, hasn’t had a job of his own for a long time now and has been helping her out in this business. Together they have built a steady clientele that makes them happy at the moment, because the very first years in the business were difficult.

Liljana is requesting a loan to purchase iron and coal for her business, and has got plans to expand her current activity.

loans.use: to purchase iron and coal for her business.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
En medio de la selva amazónica del Ecuador, al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar se encuentra la ciudad del Puyo capital de esta provincia, que es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. En esta ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo; se encuentra Verónica, una mujer de 29 años, casada con Darwin que trabaja como operador en una empresa privada, y con quien tiene la alegría de educar a dos hijos.
Verónica ha atravesado algunos obstáculos que no le permitieron terminar su carrera en la universidad, sin embargo con el apoyo de sus padres ha regresado a estudiar. Hace 9 años asistió a capacitaciones de asesoría de belleza e inició con su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Ahora solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará productos para tener en el stock disponible y sus ingresos mejorarán notablemente para sustentar los gastos de sus estudios y además apoyar en los gastos del hogar para sacar adelante sus hijos.
texts.en:
The city of Puyo is located at 924 meters above sea level in the western part of the province of Pastaza. It is the capital of this province.  Demographically speaking, the city is small, but it has a great variety of sites that attract local and international tourists - most popular of all are ecotourism activities and extreme sports. This city is growing economically every day through commerce and the industries of livestock, agriculture and tourism.

Verónica, who is 29 years old, lives in this city.  She is married to Darwin, who works for a private company.  Together they have the pleasure of raising two children. She has overcome several obstacles which did not allow her to finish her university course.  Nevertheless, with the support of her parents she has once again resumed her studies.

Nine years ago she trained as a beautician and started her own business selling cosmetics.  Currently she is seeking a loan in order to buy products to stock her business.  Her income will improve considerably, which will allow her to cover her educational expenses and also help with the household expenses and help her provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Murang'a area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has six children and has been doing this work for 30 years.  Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, other crops, and personal business. She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow. She has confidence her business will grow owing to the skills she has acquired and having lost her previous cow she knows how to go about the challenges. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming provides food for the family and  you can sell the surplus, thereby getting income!'  Her biggest challenge is 'High fertilizer and manure cost.'

Margaret was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'I was attracted by the favorably interest rate and loan term.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'The loan should be used in income generating activities or projects.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Margaret replied 'Income from the cow will help in paying school fees and in expanding farming projects.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Margaret owns the following: 'poultry, a bicycle' but does not own 'a cow, a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net' but does NOT have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pitabali Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2010, 13 women from a village stepped out and formed a group called Pitabali Self Help Group in Odisha. They help each other and share their problems and solve the problems among them.  They celebrate their festivals together in their village.  

Basanti, leader of the group, has six goats. The lady standing second from the left-hand side, and wearing a yellow saree is Basanti. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccines and fodder to them when it is required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they are full grown. It takes 8-9 months for her to have them ready to sell. 

Basanti goes out in the morning to leave the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family.  She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way she is earning to manage her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily needs.

Basanti wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. She has requested a loan of 195,000 INR in total for her group so that they can earn more and they will control their family cash flow.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing 10 goats for her goat farm.

loans.name: Urphila Busch Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URPHILA BUSCH” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulema es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, tejido a macramé, tienda de barrio, venta de artefactos electrónicos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zulema es una integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitar su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, nos da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años vendiendo cables y focos de forma ambulante y posteriormente compro los artefactos por recomendación de sus amigas. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de compra de cables, focos e interruptores) que comprará de las tiendas por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializara en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto de forma ambulante. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “URPHILA BUSCH” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. The group has nine members and is headed by a board whose secretary is Zulema. The communal bank's members have a variety of professions including selling food and clothing, weaving macramé, managing a store, and selling electrical goods.

The loan benefits micro businesses such as the one Zulema is part of. She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago when a representative of the institution visited her home. She now sells small appliances, a business she started some years ago by selling cables and light bulbs as a street vendor. Later she purchased appliances on the advice of friends.

This loan will increase her capital to buy cables, light bulbs, and switches from wholesalers so that she can resell them as a street vendor at fairs in the city of El Alto. This work lets her earn income to support her family. She is married and has three children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said she liked the health center.

loans.use: to buy cables, light bulbs, and switches.

loans.name: Etelvina De Jesus

texts.es:
Etelvina, sus ocupaciones son la agricultura y la venta de cerdos, con trabajo y perseverancia ha logrado realizar siembras en dos manzanas de terreno, tiene dos hijas con quienes vive.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como el abono y los herbicidas, que le sirven para prevenir las plagas y permiten el desarrollo del cultivo, esto ayudara a mejorar la produccion .
La aspiración de Etelvina es poder a través de esfuerzo con su familia  mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Etelvina is a farmer and raises pigs. With work and perseverance she has been able to raise crops on two manzanas (about three and a half acres) of land. She has two children, with whom she lives.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase supplies such as manure and herbicides, which help her to prevent infestations and allow the crops to develop. This will help improve production.

Etelvina's aspiration is to be able, through effort with her family, to improve the condition of her dwelling.

loans.use: to purchase manure and herbicides

loans.name: Ali Osman

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11. All of them go to school.

Ali runs a manufacturing industry and has been in business for eight years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase metal irons and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years Ali would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs.

Ali says he is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of  Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like iron metals for making doors, windows, beds, etc.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik runs a little shop where she trades food, drinks, and household goods. She started her business in October 2011 and her shop is in a very advantageous location which has allowed her to gain a large number of clients during this short period. Astghik lives with her husband, mother-in-law and school-age son and daughter. Her son plans to become a doctor and her daughter plans to become an actress. Astghik is very excited about her children's plans.

Astghik is requesting a loan to purchase more food, drinks, and items for her shop. Her loan will allow her to increase the sales and start earning more business income. "I plan to add a section of fruits and vegetables in my shop, as if the client comes to buy food, he will be willing to purchase fruits and vegetables from the same place too," says Astghik. Her loan will allow her develop and implement this plan. In the future, she dreams of earning  sufficient income to help her children reach their aims.

loans.use: to buy food, drink, and goods to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 34 years old and is married to Passyquelinah who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been a business man for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first business loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Isaac will use the loan to buy phones to sell. 

With his anticipated profits, he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to improve on his family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 59 years old, married to Nelson, and has been blessed with two children whom she supports. She rears chickens in the Narok area and has been in the business for the last ten years. She earns a monthly income of KES. 19,000. 

She is servicing her seventh loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks and broilers for fattening and resale.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to add to her birds’ numbers and pay school fees for her children. Her future dreams are to prosper and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and broilers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mahutin 10 Group

texts.fr: MAHUTIN 10 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Rose (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est une veuve. Rose est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Rose vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses différentes charges. Rose a très peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a dix huit ans environs que Rose vend de la nourriture (riz et pâte de maïs) dans son quartier. Rose exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Rose sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN 10. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Mahutin 10 is a group of three people, whose members live in the same district. The representative of the group, Rose (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and a widow. Rose is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school and are her dependents. Rose lives alone with her children and is responsible for all the household expenses. Rose has had very little formal education.

For approximately the past eighteen years Rose has been selling food (rice and corn dough) in her district. Rose runs her business with passion, as it enables her to meet her own needs as well as those of her children. Rose buys her supplies at a market in Benin. It is Rose's goal to meet the demand of her customers and to increase her working capital. To help her attain this goal, Rose is seeking her first loan from Alidé. This loan will help Rose, along with the other members of Mahutin 10, to better meet the needs of their customers and thus earn larger incomes.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, vive acompañado con su esposa y tres hijos, ellos le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura para poder sostener el lugar, tienen vivienda propia, Juan desde muy pequeño aprendió el trabajo por su padre, quien le enseñó todo el proceso de las siembras de granos básicos, tiene 20 años de trabajar en lo propio.

Está iniciando la siembra de la temporada para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en la compra de cinco sacos de bono y un depósito de herbicidas, este préstamo servirá con el dinero suficiente para realizar la compra de los materiales, permitiéndole prevenir el cultivo de las plagas.

Su aspiración es mejorar la situación económica en la familia, para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad a través del esfuerzo diario.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and three children. They help him to farm in order to be able to keep the place going. They have their own house. Starting when he was very young, Juan learned the work from his father, who taught him the whole process of planting bulk grains. He has been working on his own for 20 years.

He is starting the season's harvest, so he is asking for a loan to purchase five bags of manure and a tank of herbicide. This loan will provide him with sufficient money for the purchase of the materials, allowing him to protect the crops from infestation.

His aspiration is to improve his family's economic situation in order to be able to offer his children greater stability through daily effort.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of manure and a tank of herbicide

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
María es una joven soltera de 28 años que tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 6 años que estudian en primaria. Vive en la parroquia de Río Verde en Santo Domingo la tercera ciudad más grande de Ecuador en cuanto a población, y se encuentra ubicado en un punto estratégico para el comercio ecuatoriano ya que se ubica en el centro, actuando como unión entre la costa y la sierra. Por esta razón, Santo Domingo también es un centro multicultural donde se encuentran y fusionan varias culturas provenientes de Ecuador e inclusive de afuera del país. El turismo ha crecido notablemente por lo que el comercio de productos de todo tipo se ha convertido en una actividad muy rentable. 
En el centro de esta ciudad tan interesante, reside María quien hace dos años emprendió con la venta de cosméticos y en el cual invierte las horas necesarias para obtener las ganancias esperadas. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre KIVA y María, para adquirir un préstamo que le ayudará a comprar mercadería para tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos superando la competencia en calidad de servicio y precios. María agradece a Fundación Alternativa por aportar en el primer paso de su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
María is a young single woman of 28 years of age. She has two children aged from 10 to 6 years studying in primary. She lives in the parish of Río Verde in Santo Domingo, the third largest city in Ecuador by population. It is located at a strategic point for Ecuadorian trade being centrally located, acting as a link between the coast and the mountain range. For this reason, Santo Domingo is also a multicultural center where many cultures blend from Ecuador and also from outside the country. Tourism has grown markedly because of the trade of all types of products which has become a very profitable activity.

In the center of this interesting city lives María who began selling cosmetics two years ago in which she invests the necessary hours in order to obtain the hoped for profits. She came to Fundación Alternativa, which is the intermediary institution between Kiva and María, to acquire a loan that will help her to buy merchandise in order to have a variety to offer her clients and thus obtain better earnings surpassing the competition in quality of service and prices. María is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for providing the first step in her growing business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in order to have a variety to offer her clients

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has five children and lives in the Murang'a area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. For the past five years, she has been a farmer and her primary products are milk and crops. Catherine finds horticultural farming and growing French beans especially enjoyable. Her business challenges include the lack of irrigation equipment. Her cow, which is her farm animal, is named Meni, which is a name given to a cow with a black spot on its body

Catherine is requesting a loan to to diversify her farming business by buying poultry and fertilizer. She chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan because it is offering loans for farming. Catherine attended a required micro-finance training session and learned that it is easier to access a loan from micro-finance institutions compared to other financiers like banks. Her largest monthly expense is school fees. Catherine believes that her loan will increase her French bean and tomato crop which will help her to pay school fees and provide for her family's basic needs.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Catherine owns a cow, poultry, and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a household mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poutlry and fertilizer

loans.name: Ushirika Mazizini Group

texts.en:
Mathew, who is in his late 30s, is married with one child who goes to school.  He has been running a stationery business for three years now and works very hard. He works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good profit every month.

He is requesting his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more stationery stock and he has paid back all his loans successfully. With this loan, Mathew intends to buy stationery machines which he will use for printing and photocopying. His dream is to one day be able to own a big stationery firm.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Ushirika Mazizini", which totals 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy stationery machines for printing and photocopying.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow, aged 39 years old, who is blessed with two children aged 13 and 16 years old. She operates a beauty salon and has been running the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES. 4,000.

She has borrowed her second loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her school-aged children. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase some additional stock for the beauty salon

loans.name: Rosa Emma

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su hija de 29 años, trabaja en una unidad de salud, se dedica a los oficios de compra y venta de cerdos, con una experiencia de 15 años en esta actividad tiene un empleado el cual le ayuda en el traslado de los cerdos.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos pequeños y también concentrados para alimentarlos, está compra le ayuda para darle mantenimiento a la granja y poder aumentar el número de cerdos.
Su aspiración es fortalecer más el negocio ya que con ello podrá mejorar la disponibilidad de recursos y de clientes, al mismo tiempo tendrán mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old. She lives with her 29 year old daughter. She works in a health unit. She is dedicated to the services of buying and selling pigs, with 15 years experience in this activity. She has an employee who helps her in the movement of pigs.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of piglets and also feed to nourish them. This purchase will help her provide for the upkeep of the farm and she will be able to increase the number of pigs.

Her goal is to further strengthen the business as this will improve the availability of resources and customers, while at the same time she would have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed which will help her provide for the upkeep of the farm

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 30 años, está casada con Rigoberto, de 33 años, con quien tiene tres hijos.
Con la ayuda de su esposo, hace 2 años, logró abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda. Le va muy bien con sus ventas, ya que siempre los pobladores de su localidad acuden a su negocio por ser la primera tienda en abrir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder conversar con sus vecinos sobre diferentes temas, como el futuro de sus hijos y a veces sobre el negocio mismo. Sin embargo, la dificultad que tiene es cuando se le agotan sus productos, es cuando recurre a MFP.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old. She is married to Rigoberto, who is 33 years old, and with whom she has three children. With the help of her husband, she was able to open a store in her house 2 years ago.  The sales are going very well for her, sine the local residents always go to her locale because it is the first store to open. What she likes the most about her work is being able to talk to her neighbors about different things, like her children's future and the business itself. Nonetheless, the difficulty she has is when the products run out, and that is when she turns to MFP.

This is her 6th loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with her payments and she expects to be punctual now as well. In her communal bank she is a responsible member, and that is why she is very well liked.

With the 3,000 nuevos soles from this loan, she will stock her store with merchandise.

loans.use: to stock her store with merchandise.

loans.name: Flor De Haba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABA” iniciará el primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de artículos varios, tejido de mantas, venta  de ropa, tejido de chompas, venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es una integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus amigas quienes son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y artículos varios; nos cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió en compañía de su hermana desde hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en la en su espacio de comercialización todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Flor de Haba Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata group of businesses. There are eight members headed by a board of directors with Sra. Luisa as president. The businesses run by the women cover a wide range: selling various items, shawl weaving, clothes selling, knitting sweaters, and selling sweaters.

The loan that the women are seeking will bring many benefits to these small businesspeople. Sra. Luisa is one such person. She joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of her friends who were already members. Now she owns a business selling clothes and other articles. She and her sister have run the business for several years. 

Luisa plans to use the loan money to buy more clothing from wholesalers and then sell it on her stall. This work enables her to earn money to support as her family as best she can--she is married and has three children.

She enjoys belonging to Pro Mujer because of the loans and the savings program.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Jacqueline Azucena

texts.es:
Jacqueline, vive con su madre y una hija de dos años de edad, vive también con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas tiene dos años en este negocio, solamente vende por encargo.

Está solicitando un préstamo para utilizarlo en el negocio, invirtiendo en la compra de joyas, por ejemplo aretes, anillos, cadenas, pulseras, esta compra le ayudará a mejorar el funcionamiento del negocio y poder ofrecer a los clientes una mayor variedad, espera tener un incremento en sus ganancias.

El objetivo de ella es ir creciendo con la ayuda de los préstamos ya que esto le dará la oportunidad de ofrecer a su hija mejores beneficios en su vida.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her mother and two-year-old daughter and also with her husband.  She has been selling jewelry for two years and only sells to order.  She’s requesting a loan to use in the business buying jewelry like rings, earrings, chains and bracelets.  

This purchase will help her improve the business’ functioning and she will be able to offer her customers a wider variety of goods; she hopes to increase her profits.

Her objective is to gradually grow with help from the loans because this will give her the opportunity of providing her daughter with better life benefits.

loans.use: to buyearrings, rings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Jongkor Jongkor

texts.en:
Jongkor JongKor is a 42-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of them go to school.

Jongkor JongKor runs a clothing store and has been in business for six years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance (SS) through other clients. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase clothes, shoes and many other items. Apart from this business, he has no other source of income. 

In five years, Jongkor JongKor would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices. Jongkor Jongkor says he is happy for the loans given by Finance (SS) through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more inventory like clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Ana Amparo

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 56 años de edad, vive en su propia casa, tiene un hijo de 30 años pero no vive con ella, Ana se dedica a atender una tienda de productos domésticos lo heredó de sus madre,trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, ella depende económicamente de este negocio por eso buscan las alternativas para mantenerlo surtido de la mercadería necesaria.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse huevos, arroz, frijoles, gaseosas, pan, jugos, boquitas, que le ayudarán a mantener el negocio surtido y todo lo necesario para ofrecer a sus clientes; con este préstamo tendra los recursos para que ella realice una buena inversión en la cual pueda continuar generando buenas ventas y ganancias.
El objetivo es mantener fuerte su tiendita, que pueden mantener todo lo necesario para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
56-year old Ana lives in her own house. She has a 30-year old son but he does not live with her. Ana runs a store selling household products that she inherited from her mother. She works every day from 6 am to 7 pm. All her income comes from the store so she is looking for ways to keep it well-stocked.

Ana is seeking a loan to buy eggs, rice, beans, soft drinks, bread, juice, and snacks which will enable her to fully stock her store with all the items that her customers ask for. The loan will provide her with working capital so she can continue to make many sales and earn a good income. 

Her objective is to keep her store running well and do whatever is necessary to continue working.

loans.use: buy eggs, rice, beans, soft drinks, bread, juice, and snacks

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de frijol, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene tres hijos quienes le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, Daniel tiene 10 años de estar trabajando en lo propio, aprendió desde muy pequeño al lado de su padre, hoy en día él enseña a sus hijos para que éstos también puedan desempeñar esta labor.

Está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales agrícolas que le ayuda a los agricultores a prevenir las playas de la siembra y también a fortalecer el desarrollo, será su compra en cinco sacos de abono y una bolsa de semillas para sembrar, gracias a este crédito podrá invertir en el cultivo de maíz y poder tener una mejor productividad que le pueda dejar ganancias al momento de comercializar.

Su sueño es mantener a su familia en mejores condiciones económicas que sus hijos no sufran pobrezas, que tengan siempre la fuerza de trabajo para poder honradamente ganarse el alimento.
texts.en:
Daniel works growing corn and beans.  He’s 46-years-old and has three children that help him work in agriculture.  Daniel’s been working for himself for ten years.  He learned while still very young from his father.  Today, he teaches his children so that they too can work in this occupation.

He’s requesting a loan to buy farm supplies that help farmers avoid crop pests and also to strengthen development.  He will buy five sacks of manure and a bag of seeds to plant.  Thanks to this loan he will be able to invest in his corn crops and have better productivity which will mean higher profits at the time of sale.

His dream is to keep his family in better economic conditions and that his children not have any wants; that they always get strength from work so that they can earn their daily sustenance honestly.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of manure and a bag of seeds.

loans.name: Tap's Group

texts.en:
Tap is 54 years old, and has two adult children.  She is divorced from her husband.  She is a farmer and rents tents.  She earns 7,000,000 VND a month from renting them.  She has participated in SEDA's crediting program since 2009.  During the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time.  In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND to upgrade and repair her renting tents.

Vui is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to do her mechanical repairing job.

loans.use: to upgrade and repair her renting tents.

loans.name: Dúo Shama Group

texts.es:
DUO SHAMA 
doña María Estela quien es la líder del grupo, nos cuenta que está casada y tiene 2 hijos nos cuenta que están estudiando y ella vende ropa típica desde hace ya  10 años, y nos cuenta que necesita el crédito para comprar ropa típica ya que este tipo de ropa es muy caro y necesita mucho capital, pero ella quiere un apoyo para incrementar su negocio ahora, sale a vender a las aldeas para vender un poco mas y su clientela le pide nuevos estilos de blusas, sandalias y suéteres ella espera complacer a la clientela ya que se acerca septiembre el mes en donde compran ropa para los diferentes desfiles que hay en las comunidades espera el apoyo como kiva le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Shama Duo.

María Estela is the group leader.  She relates that she’s married and has two children who are attending school.  She’s been selling traditional clothing for ten years now and she relates that she needs the loan to buy traditional clothes since this type of clothing is very expensive and she needs much capital but she wants support so that she can increase her business now.  She goes out to the villages to sell a bit more and her customers request new styles of blouses, sandals and sweaters.  She hopes to satisfy her customers because September is approaching and that’s when they buy clothes for the various parades that occur in the communities.  She hopes for the support like Kiva’s given her.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginio

texts.es:
Virginio tiene 57 años, es viudo hace 5 años, por lo que quedó solo al cuidado de su único hijo Marcelino, de 19 años. Juntos habitan su casa propia, la que compró gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano.
Su labor es labrar la tierra, cultiva cacao, café y plátano. Esta actividad la vienen realizando durante 35 años, y ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es obtener una buena producción y mejor calidad de sus productos, ya que así puede venderlos a buenos precios por cada kilogramo, además sabe que si descuida sus cultivos puede ser un problema, ya que dañaría la buena calidad de sus cosechas.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará abono y otros fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Virginio is 57 years old and became a widower five years ago, when he was left alone to care for his only son, Marcelino, who is 19 years old. They live in the house he owns, which he bought through his daily hard work.

He works farming his land and grows cacao, coffee and bananas. He has been doing this work for 35 years and now has his son’s help. What he likes most about his work is having harvests which are both high yield and high quality because that is when he can sell at good prices per kilogram. As well he knows that if he neglects his crops it can be a problem because it will lower the high quality of his harvests. 

This is his eighth loan from MFP. He knows hat if he pays on time he will be able to have access to other loans more easily and will not cause complications for his communal bank. With this loan of  S/. 3,000, he will buy compost and other fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops.

loans.use: to purchase compost and other fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 33 años, su pareja es Faustino, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, a quienes desean brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La casa donde viven es propia, la lograron comprar con los ahorros de su trabajo.
Ella cultiva cacao y café, productos que vende a los centros de acopio de su localidad. Esta labor le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y sustentar los gastos de educación de sus hijos, es por ello que pone todas sus ganas en sacar adelante sus cultivos. Se siente muy feliz cuidando de sus plantas, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes químicos y estiércol para la buena producción de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Susana is 33-years-old and her spouse is Faustino; they have four children they want to give a better quality of life to.  The house they live in is theirs; they succeeded in buying it with savings from work.

She grows cocoa beans and coffee that she sells to her local gathering centers.  This work has yielded income necessary to support herself and cover her children’s educational expenses which is why she works so hard to have successful harvests.  She feels very happy caring for her plants.  She’s been in this activity for 12 years and considers the most difficult part transporting the products from her field to her community.

This is her 6th MFP loan.  She’s been very punctual with her previous loans and expects to be so again now.  She’s a very participative member of her communal bank and is always aware of the agreements the group reaches.  She will use these 3000 new soles to buy chemical fertilizer and guano to improve her crop yields.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and guano.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more toys including games, cars, balls, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is from the village of Villaluz. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Precilla owns a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local members of the community. Precilla has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Teodor

texts.es:
Teodor tiene 46 años, es un hombre trabajador que gracias a ese empeño diario obtuvo la  casa donde ahora habita junto a su esposa Josefa y su hijo Fredy de 12 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
Él cultiva cacao, café y hoja de coca, es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo, donde viene trabajando desde hace 26 años. La faena más larga es la cosecha, para ello contrata jornaleros quienes se encargan de la recolección y el traslado de los productos hasta cierto tramo en la carretera para luego ser transportados. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo hoy disfruta de ver que sus plantas son saludables y productivas, por lo que obtiene buenas ganancias.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por ello se siente muy contento de saber que contará, una vez más, con este apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de seguir prosperando, y está dispuesto a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen a abonar sus cultivos con los sacos de abono orgánico que también comprará.
texts.en:
Teodor, 46, is a hardworking man who thanks to his daily efforts acquired the house he now lives in with his wife, Josefa, and their 12-year-old son, Fredy; he wants to provide him with a better quality of life.

He grows cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf.  He is quite aware of the hard work required in the fields; he’s been working there for 26 years.  The longest chore is harvesting and he hires day laborers who do the picking and carry the grains a certain distance to the highway to be transported.  He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his efforts he today enjoys seeing his plants healthy and productive which means good profits.

This is his sixth MFP loan and he’s very happy that he will once again have financial support because he’ll be sure to continue making progress this way; he’s determined to make his installment payments punctually as scheduled.

He will use the 2000 new soles he’s requested to hire day laborers who will help him fertilize his crops with the sacks of organic manure he’ll also buy.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to help him fertilize his crops with the sacks of organic manure he'll also buy.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 45 años, está casado con Olimpia, de 46 años, con quien compartió muchas alegrías y esfuerzos para lograr comprar su casa propia, en la que ahora habitan junto a sus tres queridos hijos.
Vicente y su esposa se dedican a la venta de comestibles en la tienda que implementaron hace 5 años en su vivienda. A él le gusta su trabajo, ya que siempre está conversando con sus vecinos. Esta actividad es muy rentable, por lo que siempre tiene ingresos económicos y todo gracias a sus clientes, porque siempre encuentran lo necesario para la preparación de sus alimentos. Sin embargo, hay días en que sus productos más pedidos se llegan a terminar, como el arroz y azúcar, es por ello que cuenta con el apoyo de MFP.

Este es su crédito número 16 y una vez más promete ser puntual en sus pagos, como en anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es un socio responsable, ya que desea que sus compañeros sigan su ejemplo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará dos sacos de arroz y uno de azúcar, para que así no le falte nada en su tienda.
texts.en:
Vicente, 45, is married to Olimpia, 46, with whom he’s shared many joys and efforts to buy their own house where they now live with their three beloved children.

Vicente and his wife work selling foodstuffs in their store they set up five years ago at home.  He likes his job because he’s always chatting with his neighbors.  This is a very profitable activity so he always has income thanks to his customers because they always find what they need to prepare their meals.  However, there are days when his most popular items, like rice and sugar, run out and this is why he counts on MFP’s support.

This is his 16th MFP loan and once again he promises to be punctual with his payments like he’s been with previous loans.  He’s a responsible member of his communal bank because he wants his fellow members to follow his example.

He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy two sacks of rice and one of sugar so that his store will have everything needed.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and one of sugar to stock his store.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, 26, raises hogs and lives in Baliuag with her spouse and two children. Though she only generates a minimal income, she was very thankful for it as a supplement to her husband's farming income. She is borrowing 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy medicines and hog feed to sustain her business. She will take care of her hogs so they will grow healthier and sell them at a profit upon maturity. 

Someday, she hopes to make the business more profitable and earn the funds necessary to alleviate her family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines and hog feed for sustainability

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn intends to improve her business to make it a practical source of income. She is 24 years old and has one child. 

To improve her business, Ronalyn is asking for additional capital of 8,000 PHP to buy more bananas to sell in the village. She also wants to purchase  MSE (Marikina Shoe Exchange) and Avon products as her additional source of income. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved. This will be a great help to improve the business, and she is hoping that she will be successful for the sake of her child and soon children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in the village

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Mujeres Unidas esta conformado por 9 integrantes,   todas son mujeres con  edades  comprendida de 20 a 30 años responsables de un total de 12 hijos.   Ellas pertenecen  a la localidad de  Santa Rosa del Peñón un municipio en la zona norte de león. Lugar que se caracteriza por su gente muy humilde, trabajadora,  es una zona muy agrícolas,  siembra plátanos, maíz. Estas nueves mujeres se unieron en forma grupal para obtener el beneficio del crédito y apoyarse mutuamente, todas se conocen son del mismo lugar lo cual pueden dar fe de las responsabilidad de cada una de ellas. Todas tienen diferentes actividades económicas como son: venta de medicina natural, fritanga, venta de calzado. Ellas se dedican a su negocio una  12 horas diarias para poder obtener cliente e ingresos  y a pesar de su rutina  muy dura y su jornada laborar muy pesado ya que muchas de ellas  su forma de vida es vender sus productos de forma ambulante, bajo el intenso sol del día a día pero para ellas eso no es impedimento porque disfrutan diariamente su trabajo el gusto que les queda de haber complacidos a sus clientes. El banco comunal Mujeres Unidas se encuentran muy agradecidas con los prestatarios kiva por la ayuda que les brindan para poder realizar la inversión en sus diferentes negocios. Oneyda Patricia es la coordinadora del banco ella tiene por actividad la venta de medicina natural de forma ambulante y en su casa, y el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en su pequeño negocio como: Medicamento Natural (preparadas por hierbas y no por productos químicos) eje de hierbas yanten, romero, manzanilla, linaza.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas Community Bank has nine members, all women between the ages of 20 and 30. Between them they support twelve children. They live in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a municipality north of León, an area known for its simple, hardworking people who work in agriculture growing bananas and corn. The nine women formed a group so they could access credit and help each other. They all know each other as they are from the same area; this makes each one feel responsible for the other members.

They have a variety of businesses such as selling natural medicine, making fried snacks, and selling footwear. They work twelve hours a day to attract customers and earn money. Despite the routine and hard work (many of the women sell their goods in the streets under the hot sun), the women say that this is not a problem and they enjoy their jobs and pleasing their customers. 

The Mujeres Unidas Community Bank is very grateful to Kiva donors for the help that they provide for their various businesses. Oneyda Patricia is the coordinator of the bank. She sells natural medicines in the streets and from her house. She needs the loan to buy natural medicines, made from herbs such as yanten, rosemary, camomile, and linseed, not chemicals.

loans.use: buy natural ingredients such as yanten, rosemary, camomile, and linseed to make medicine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 38 años, está casada con Alejandro, de 40 años, quien la apoya en todo sus esfuerzos, ya que gracias a ello pudo comprar la casa donde habitan con sus seis hijos.
Victoria y su esposo vienen labrando sus tierras desde hace 15 años, y hoy es toda una conocedora de la ardua labor en el campo. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de sus productos ella contrata peones para acelerar el trabajo. A Victoria le gusta lo que hace por que gracias a ello adquirió su casa. Ella solicita el crédito para mejorar sus tierras y volverlas más productivas con la compra de fertilizantes.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, por lo que se siente muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, y está dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados.
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono y otros fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Victoria, 38, is married to Alejandro, 40, who supports all her efforts because thanks to them she was able to buy the house they live in with their six children.

Victoria and her husband have been working their land for 15 years and today she’s quite expert in hard work in the fields.  During harvest and product transport seasons she hires day laborers to quicken the work.  Victoria likes what she does because thanks to it she was able to buy a house.  She’s requesting the loan to improve the soil and make it more productive; she will buy fertilizer.

This is her 6th MFP loan and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support and is determined to repay it punctually as scheduled.

She will use these 3000 new soles to buy sacks of manure and other fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and other fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 46 años, está casada con Teodosio, de 38 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia, la que compraron con las ganancias de su trabajo, donde habitan junto a sus tres hijos.
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de ladrillos, actividad que realizan en un campo donde cuentan con un horno artesanal. Ellos trabajan junto a tres personas que contratan para que los ayuden con la producción. Este negocio lo tienen desde hace 6 años y siempre tienen pedidos en diferentes comunidades, lo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos.

Este es su crédito número 13, son más de 6 años que trabajan con MFP, y una vez más agradece el apoyo que recibe. Nuevamente promete ser responsable con sus cuotas de pago y no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará más tierras arcillosas para seguir elaborando ladrillos.
texts.en:
Victoria, 46, is married to Teodosio, 38.  They live in their own house that they bought with profits from their work; they live there with their three children.

She and her husband work selling bricks, an activity they carry out in a field where they have an artisanal oven.  They work with three other people who they hire to help with production.  They’ve had the business for six years and always have orders from various communities which generate good income.

This is her 13th MFP loan and once again she is grateful for the support she gets.  Once again, she promises to be responsible with her installment payments and not disappoint her communal bank.  She will use these 1000 new soles to buy more clay-rich soil to continue making bricks.

loans.use: to buy more clay rich soil to make bricks.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio tiene 24 años, es un joven soltero que vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes apoya con su trabajo de cada día.
Él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros de comunidad en comunidad. Cuenta con un auto propio que compró con la ayuda de sus padres. Empezó hace un año y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus colegas, ya que hablan de cómo salir adelante. Como todo transportista, sus dificultades son cuando su carro se descompone o no se realiza el mantenimiento (lavado y engrase). Para ello es que necesita el crédito, ya que gracias a ello podrá seguir con su trabajo, mejorando su carro.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, se siente contento por esta nueva oportunidad y agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. En su banco comunal es un socio activo y puntual con sus cuotas de pago.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará nuevos parabrisas, espejos y lo que requiera necesario el mecánico que arreglará su carro.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 24, is a young single man living in his parents’ house; he helps support them with his daily work.  He works providing transportation for passengers from community to community.  He has a car he bought with his parents’ help.  He started a year ago and what he likes best is chatting with his colleagues because they talk about ways to get ahead.  Like all transportation providers his difficulty arises when his car breaks down or it isn’t serviced (washing and lubrication).  For that, he needs the loan because thanks to it he’ll be able to stay in business and improve his car.

This is his 3rd MFP loan and he’s happy with this new opportunity and thanks those who make it possible.  He’s a very active, punctual installment paying member of his communal bank.  He will use these 1000 new soles to buy new windshields, mirrors and everything else needed by the mechanic to repair his car.

loans.use: to buy new windshields, mirrors and whatever else is necessary to repair his car.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 40 años, su pareja es Auron, de 39 años, con él tiene cuatro hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la obtuvieron gracias a su esfuerzo de cada día.
Ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, tienen una parcela con hojas de coca, cacao y maní. En tiempos de cosecha necesitan apoyo extra, por eso contratan jornaleros para avanzar con la extracción de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan una recompensa. Por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su localidad, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y hojas de coca. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y se siente muy comprometida en cumplir con sus cronogramas de pagos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará  fertilizantes e insecticidas para mejoras sus plantaciones y así obtener buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 40-years-old and her spouse is Auron, 39.  They have four children and the house they live in is theirs; they acquired it thanks to their daily efforts.

They have been working in agriculture for fifteen years.  They have a parcel planted with coca leaf, cocoa beans and peanuts.  During harvest season they need extra help so they hire day laborers to do the picking more quickly.  What she likes best about her work is harvesting because that’s when the reward for long months of hard work is received.  On the other hand, she considers the most difficult part having to transport her products from the field to her location where the best prices for her grains and coca leaf are offered.  For later on, she’d like to buy new land to increase her crops.

This is her 3rd MFP loan and she feels very committed to make her payments as scheduled.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve her crops and have better fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Butenga Parents Group

texts.en:
The Butenga Parents Group is located on the outskirts of Mpigi. The group is comprised mainly of women and one man whose major activity is agriculture. Their goal is to support each other out of poverty.

James is a divorced man with eight children; six of them are still in school. He also looks after his three nieces.

James is mainly an agriculturist who grows crops and rears pigs; he supplements the farming with firewood trading.

With the income from firewood trading and capital of 500,000 shillings, he resorted to agriculture in 1999 after separating from his wife so that he could fend for his children and take them to school.

He will use his loan to buy organic manure to improve his crop yields. His main customers are market vendors and passersby. The main challenges are price fluctuations and pests, which affect his cash flow.

His dream is to build a good house for his family.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.
